	<item>
		<title>Web</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/web-design/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 24 Feb 2006 12:29:40 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/11/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<img src="http://blog.andreineculau.com/2006/02/computer.jpg" alt="computer.jpg" align="right" height="180" width="240" />
<blockquote><strong>It's still a mystery to me. Then again it'll always be.</strong></blockquote>
I enjoy creating websites as long as they don't have the 'two pictures &amp; two pages' label. Starting at the age of 13, I never stopped enjoying experiences of web-design in HTML code, along with JavaScript, Perl, PHP, ASP, Flash and other web-related features of the Internet.
<blockquote>I'm now concentrating on dynamic pages, so I'm up to date with PHP and ASP, thus covering a large area of server-side scripting. I'm also taking my interests down to ColdFusion technology. It would be an understatement to say "I also use databases". They are the center of my work, making use of structured data, at top-most levels.</blockquote>
Macromedia Flash: To tell you the truth, building movies isn't very hard to do, but building attractive movies takes a lot of work and creativity. I'm not afraid of that, but I don't concentrate on them as a main tool for web development.
<blockquote>On the right side of this page you can see the subpages, which are actually a portofolio of my web works.</blockquote>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<title>Life-Link Friendship-Schools</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/web-design/life-link-friendship-schools/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 24 Feb 2006 12:33:16 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/11/life-link-friendship-schools/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<b>The offical website of a major Swedish NGO.
Online at: <a href="http://www.life-link.org/" target="_blank">http://www.life-link.org/</a></b>
<blockquote><b>Mainly concentrated on database information managing. Provides clean and well-structured information, along with news, advanced use of database utilities, chatroom and photo gallery. Has become a good administrative tool for the office.</b></blockquote>
<blockquote><b>Starting from 2004, the website has been restructured and re-designed, aiming for defining some sort of NGO branding, attracting people through visual, not just intellectual aspects. The design concentrated on color combination and slick, yet not exhausting models. Client-side JavaScript, Dynamic HTML and style sheets have helped a lot, giving the ability to play with visuals and making the website a bit more functional.</b></blockquote>
<b></b><b>Technologies:</b> CSS, JavaScript, ASP (VBScript), Access DB, Flash]]></content:encoded>

Used to be online at: <a href="http://www.islandmunga.org/" target="_blank">http://www.islandmunga.org/</a>
<blockquote>The project is based on a Model of United Nations General Assembly, and was hosted by Sandown High-School, Isle of Wight, UK.</blockquote>
<blockquote>The Media aspect of the project consisted in website design, online magazine and photography, all incorporated in this website. Based on the concept of the previously created websites, the Island MUNGA website provides language-switch, use of database layers and has a clean, slick layout.</blockquote>
<blockquote>To conclude, this is mainly a multilingual website, offering its contents in over 10 European languages, including Russian.</blockquote>

<blockquote>It has a very fancy combination of CSS, JavaScript and clean graphics. Many modules have been combined, like search engine, pollroom, forum and webmail service. <blockquote>The website incorporates a specially designed web application, consisting in a forum service. With the use of advanced database layered information, the forum provides an easy to use message board for the high school's alumni. 		<title>Web Finances Software</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/web-design/web-finances-software/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 24 Feb 2006 12:52:11 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/11/web-finances-software/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<b>A project for Romanian Public Finances.</b>
<blockquote>This application was needed by Romanian officials, to implement web management of different databases, containing financial and accounting information.</blockquote>
<blockquote>Access is strictly secured, password being sent with MD5 encryption, and it is also structured by access levels, providing security to different information exchange.</blockquote>
<blockquote>It uses highly JavaScript programming in order for interaction with users to be natural and to easily follow the steps to take.</blockquote>
<b>Technologies:</b> PHP, CSS, JavaScript]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Romania&#039;s True Face</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/web-design/romanias-true-face/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 24 Feb 2006 13:10:24 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/11/romanias-true-face/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<b>The website of a ThinkQuest challenger.</b>
<blockquote>The website provides an introspective into the Romanian part of the globe. Thus, offers information on the country's geography, history, literature, and politics.</blockquote>
<blockquote>Built in the year of 2000, it was a team effort, and gave a good inside towards a neutral and objective approach of the "Romania's True Face".</blockquote>
<blockquote>Extensive Flash and Javascript are used, to cover the lack of a possible PHP programming, due to the contest's rules. Though, it has some PERL dynamic pages, by offering a quick quiz.</blockquote>
<b>Technologies:</b> Flash, CSS, JavaScript, Frames, PERL]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Soft</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/software/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 25 Feb 2006 18:05:41 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/software/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<img src="http://blog.andreineculau.com/2006/02/keyb.jpg" alt="keyb.jpg" align="right" height="180" width="240" />
<blockquote><strong>I'm in this domain for more than 8 years. I'll work in this direction for many more.</strong></blockquote>
I guess that every programmer starts with easy things, like making a clock, or making childish graphics. I first came in touch with the computer at the age of 7, working with simple BASIC features. I continued learning with professional assistance until I was 10. Then in primary school I worked in a Pascal environment. And then C++ in high school.
<blockquote>If that's all the school teaches me, why wouldn't I learn something by myself?. And I did. Delphi was the answer. During the years I've been developing software for the Windows environment. It's quite hard to keep up with the code-programming and with the interface-designing at the same time, but I love it.</blockquote>
There is no problem in developing multimedia applications either. I think Flash would just do it, as it is very well featured for this type of software. This concept was tested succesfully during the project of creating my high-school's presentation CD.
<blockquote>Recently (end of 2004) I've added another side to the software domain: web-applications. A firm wanted a database structured software to be made available online, having to deal with finance operations, with security levels, and so on.</blockquote>
I'm currently focusing on Management Systems!]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>IT Assistance</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/?page_id=56</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 26 May 2008 16:22:29 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.com/blog/?page_id=56</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<div style="float:right; margin:5px"><object classid="clsid:d27cdb6e-ae6d-11cf-96b8-444553540000" width="228" height="277" codebase="http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,40,0"><param name="id" value="white_widget" /><param name="align" value="middle" /><param name="allowScriptAccess" value="sameDomain" /><param name="quality" value="high" /><param name="bgcolor" value="#ffffff" /><param name="src" value="http://www.crossloop.com/widgets/white_widget.swf?var1=112652&amp;var2=http://www.crossloop.com" /><embed id="white_widget" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="228" height="277" src="http://www.crossloop.com/widgets/white_widget.swf?var1=112652&amp;var2=http://www.crossloop.com" bgcolor="#ffffff" quality="high" allowscriptaccess="sameDomain" align="middle"></embed></object><img style="visibility: hidden; width: 0px; height: 0px;" src="http://counters.gigya.com/wildfire/CIMP/bT*xJmx*PTEyMTE4MTg4NzcxNTAmcHQ9MTIxMTgxODg4Mzc5MyZwPTE1NDE*MSZkPSZuPSZnPTE=.jpg" border="0" alt="" width="0" height="0" /></div>
<h2>Why?</h2>
I have more than 12 years of experience with Microsoft operating systems, since their early beginnings.

In this time, I ended up fixing a large variety of bugs and eliminating unwanted situations, around Windows itself and software running on Windows.

I've had lots to do with organizing conference media presentations, and also with coding different applications, in quite a few frameworks.

I've tried them all (i.e. software applications and solutions) and I've seen them all.

<strong>So why not use that experience and give a hand?</strong>

Without further due, <a href="http://www.crossloop.com/andreineculau">contact me</a> and I'll simply get you out of trouble the best way I know!
<h2>How?</h2>
CrossLoop is a nice software that gives relatively easy access to your display, mouse and keyboard. With it, I can connect to your computer and find my way around fixing your terminal. You can always see what I am doing, and disconnect me accordingly, so don't worry about your computer's security. No data will be downloaded, no information will be transfered.

After contacting me, just
<ul>
	<li><a href="http://www.crossloop.com/ipage.htm?id=download">download it</a></li>
	<li>install &amp; run it</li>
	<li>click the Share tab</li>
	<li>let me know what the Access Code is</li>
	<li>click Connect and wait for me</li>
</ul>
<h2>Other ways to help?</h2>
Sure! If your problem is more serious and you happen to be in Stockholm, Sweden, I can take a look at your computer hands-on! Just get in touch with me.

Or if you want to use another remote-control application.. again, fine by me!]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Encryption Software</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/software/encryption-software/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 18 Mar 2006 08:39:12 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/software/encryption-software/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<b>Software for easy, yet strong encryption.</b>
<blockquote>The project started years ago, around 1998. The idea was to  create a small software application to encrypt several files into one archive,  and to use as many, yet memory-effective methods to secure them.</blockquote>
<blockquote>The  nowadays project includes a compression module and a public-password module  allowing the result to have a much higher security and a size similar to the  original ones. The software works in a similar environment like  WinAce.</blockquote>
<blockquote>All of the modules are customizable and provide flexibility, ease  and integration in the Windows environment. The project can be used for a number  of purposes and can be customized to reach the needs of every  user.</blockquote>
<b>Technologies:</b> Borland Delphi, BZIP compression, Threads]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>About</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/?page_id=297</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 09 Apr 2008 14:37:01 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.com/blog/?page_id=2</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<h2>Resumé / Curriculum Vitae</h2>
<ul>
	<li>[download#1#size#nohits]</li>
	<li>A Resumé with a short job interview is available in <a href="http://andrei.neculau.ejobs.ro/" target="_blank">English</a> and in <a href="http://neculau.andrei.ejobs.ro/" target="_blank">Romanian</a></li>
</ul>
<h2>Summary</h2>
<ul style="padding-left:20px;">
	<li><big>Name</big>
<strong>Andrei NECULAU</strong>
-</li>
	<li><big>Parents</big> to who I'm endlessly grateful
<strong>Ion &amp; Doina-Brândușa</strong>
-</li>
	<li><big>Born</big>
<strong>4 may 1984</strong>
-</li>
	<li><big>Nationality</big>
<strong>Romanian</strong>
-</li>
	<li><big>Residence</big>
<strong>Kista, SWEDEN</strong>
-</li>
	<li><big>Self-view</big>
<strong>Merely a living soul;
mostly one that survives.</strong>

<strong>Often seeing the best in people;
surely one that dies trying.</strong>
-</li>
	<li><big>Motto</big>
2006 <span style="text-decoration: line-through;">Gaining back the state of mind to say: “I prefer to be a crazy optimist than a foolish pessimist.” (A. Einstein)</span>
2007 <strong>Try not to become a man of success, but rather a man of value. (Albert E.)</strong>
-</li>
	<li><big>Previous Blogs</big>
<a href="http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/">„Andrie” (previous Personal Website)</a>
<a href="http://desiderius.wordpress.com/">Desiderius (personal Erasmus experience in Poland)</a></li>
</ul>
<h2>Contact</h2>
<ul style="padding-left:20px;">
	<li><a title="Click to make a SkypeOut Call" href="skype:+46737359632?call">+46 (0)73 73 59 632</a> <a title="Click to send an SMS with Skype" href="skype:+46737359632?sms">[SMS]</a></li>
	<li>+40 (0)721 27 77 44 <a title="Click to send an SMS with Skype" href="skype:+40721277744?sms">[SMS only]</a></li>
	<li><a title="Click to send an e-mail" href="mailto:andrei.neculau@gmail.com">andrei.neculau [at] gmail.com</a></li>
</ul>

	<item>
		<title>Conference Management</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/software/conference-managegement/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 18 Mar 2006 08:44:20 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/software/conference-managegement/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<b>Take control over conferences the way you want to.</b>
<blockquote>During a conference, specific rules may have to be followed,  including protocols and timed speeches. Instead of using a time watch, and  having a very well trained chairperson, and even chair assistants, this  technology provides a very good alternative.</blockquote>
<blockquote>This specific software was  successfuly used during a Model of United Nations General Assembly, on the Isle  of Wight, United Kingdom. During a General Assembly, country delegates give  speeches, reply one to another, and finally vote resolutions. The software  assists the conference at a very high level, and, along with a video projector  behaves like a secretary general. Makes a list of speakers, times speeches,  counts votes, and also gives a good transcript of the whole  meeting.</blockquote>
<b>Technologies:</b> Borland Delphi]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>78</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2006-03-18 10:44:20</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2006-03-18 08:44:20</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>conference-managegement</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>private</wp:status>

		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>

	<item>
		<title>the STATEMENT</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/front-page/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 21 Apr 2006 23:27:38 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://andreineculau.wordpress.com/front-page/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[I am taking a break from blogging.

It's nothing of a big-words statement. It just isn't what made me.

From a small child, I was fed with "Information is power". And it is, and it does matter who you share it with, but, most of all, it matters what type of information it is.

To be concise:
<ol>
	<li>Most of the information on this blog isn't cut for useful. Who's to say? My standards and thoughts say that. So there is no real need to share it. Not useful, but it is also not defining me.
I won't deny that indeed I think that there are quite a strong bunch of things that are useful, if not unique with respect to knowledge. These are mostly the pages on Erasmus, Toefl, Studera and Romanian Keyboard Layouts.</li>
	<li>The last couple of years, including the experience of having this blog, have raised my ability and awareness concerning putting a layout for my ideas, thoughts and feelings. Therefore I guess I'm mature enough to restrict my output to that kind of output that has a header, a body and a footer, an output that links a hypothesis within a context with demonstration based on pure arguments.</li>
	<li>In the last year or so, coincidently or not... the time when blogging has been quite intense, I didn't create something... to show off with (as a friend would say :p). I did NOT create. I've been talking about creating, but enough jaw-jaw. I want war!</li>
	<li>Although the thought of having readers is not to be neglected, I'm not made for <i>posterity</i>. Regarding this, I admit that reaching an estimate of 500 readers a day, without any tricks, is something to take into consideration.</li>
</ol>
-
Having said that, I will go back to my "sheep" as a Romanian saying goes.

I will reply to comments and such on the blog, but publishing will be severely restricted.

Who am I?
<ul>
	<li>A Romanian bachelor student</li>
	<li>Programmer, Computer guy, Radical critic, Improvement addict</li>
	<li>Board member of a Swedish NGO - <a href="http://www.life-link.org">Life-Link Friendship-Schools</a></li>
	<li>A believer and against all odds an optimist</li>
	<li>... <a href="http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/curriculum-vitae-resume/">the rest lies in my CV</a></li>
</ul>
-
What I may become this year?
<ul>
	<li>A cleaner-minded person</li>
	<li>A Romanian bachelor student with a thorough degree project and a diploma</li>
	<li>A master student in Sweden</li>
	<li>A programmer with a product along his vision and principles</li>
	<li>A conference planner/executive director</li>
</ul>
-
And there is one more thing... the feeling of surrendering.
<p align="center">[youtube=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VXnhOiin06M]</p>
Care!
Andrei / 2008-01-4

-

-

War
<b>the TRUTH</b>
<blockquote><b>And it's not a matter of
whether the war is <i>not</i> real or if it <i>is</i>.</b>

Victory is not possible.

The war is not meant to be won, it is meant to be continuous.

Hierarchical society is only possible on the basis of poverty and ignorance.

This new version <i>is</i> the past and no different past can ever have existed.

In principle the war effort is always planned to keep society on the brink of starvation.

The war is waged by the ruling group against its own subjects and its object is not the victory over either Eurasia or East Asia but to keep the very structure of society intact.

* George Orwell</blockquote>
-----

With all my heart
<b>the WISH</b>
<blockquote><span style="font-family:'Lucida Handwriting','Comic Sans Serif',fantasy;">~
Lord grant that I shall never seek</span>
<span style="font-family:'Lucida Handwriting','Comic Sans Serif',fantasy;"> So much to be consoled as to console</span>
<span style="font-family:'Lucida Handwriting','Comic Sans Serif',fantasy;"> To be understood as to understand</span>
<span style="font-family:'Lucida Handwriting','Comic Sans Serif',fantasy;"> Or to be loved as to love</span>
<span style="font-family:'Lucida Handwriting','Comic Sans Serif',fantasy;"> With all my heart</span>
<span style="font-family:'Lucida Handwriting','Comic Sans Serif',fantasy;"> With all my heart</span>
<span style="font-family:'Lucida Handwriting','Comic Sans Serif',fantasy;"> ~</span>

* Medic Doc Roe, night pray at the battle of Bulge [Bastogne], World War 2
<a href="http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0185906/" target="_blank">Band of Brothers</a></blockquote>
The text is actually part of a Prayer for Peace
<blockquote>Lord, make me an instrument of Thy peace. Where there is hatred, let me sow love; where there is injury, pardon; where there is doubt, faith; where there is despair, hope; where there is darkness, light; and where there is sadness, joy. O Divine Master, guide that I may not so much seek to be consoled as to console; to be understood as to understand; to be loved, as to love. For it is in giving that we receive, it is in pardoning that we are pardoned, and it is in dying that we are born to eternal life. Amen.</blockquote>
-----

I'll Keep Shut
<b>the FORGIVENESS</b>
<blockquote> Uneori îmi vine să scriu, | <b>Sometimes I feel like writing,</b>
uneori îmi vine să cânt, | <b>sometimes I feel like singing,</b>
de cele mai multe ori | <b>most of the times</b>
îmi vine să tac. | <b>I feel like keeping shut.</b>

Iertaţi-mă, | <b>Forgive me,</b>
sunt şi eu om! | <b>I'm also a human being!</b>

* Nicu Alifantis</blockquote>
-----

Do nothing
<b>the BAN</b>
<blockquote>The only thing necessary for the triumph of evil is for good men to do nothing.
* Edmund Burke</blockquote>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Angelica</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/angelica/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 17 Oct 2006 22:04:48 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/angelica/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[20061018
<ol>
	<li><a href="http://picasaweb.google.com/andrei.neculau/AngelicaPirlea" target="_blank">Album PicasaWeb AngelicaPirlea</a></li>
	<li><a href="http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/angelica/bebe/">Bebé</a></li>
	<li>Suedia, 2001</li>
	<li>Cei 2 Euro cenţi</li>
	<li>Slovacia, 2002</li>
	<li>Anglia, 2003</li>
	<li>Mail-uri</li>
	<li>Telefoane, cărţi, etc.</li>
	<li><a href="http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/angelica/cea-mai-recenta-discutie/">Cea mai recentă discuţie...</a></li>
	<li>Un ultim cuvânt</li>
	<li><a href="http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/angelica/si-viata-de-dupa/">Şi viaţa de după</a></li>
</ol>
Nici nu ştiu ce să scriu, cum să scriu... dar ştiu despre cine scriu, şi ştiu de ce scriu.

Scriu... nu pentru că ar exista posibilitatea s-o uit pe Angelica, ci pentru că aş vrea ca şi alţii să ştie că a existat un suflet care a însemnat mult pentru mulţi, chiar dacă ne-am ciocnit doar şi pentru o secundă cu el.

Nu sunt vorbe mari...  îmi pare rău că vor rămâne doar vorbe pentru atâţia care nici nu vor şti cât de mult au pierdut prin faptul că o simplă, oacheşă şi uimitor de sclipitoare profesoară de română şi-a îndeplinit menirea mai repede poate decât trebuia, dar cu siguranţă mai repede decât mi-am imaginat vreodată.

Restrâng într-o frază lucrurile cărora aproape că nu le dau nici o valoare: Angelica Pîrlea, profesoară de română, Galaţi, România, cu un suflet născut pe 11 August 1972, cu o parte din el renăscut sub numele de Ilinca, dacă nu mă înşel, în vara lui 2006. Precum esenţele tari, într-un corp minuscul, dar care caracterul îl făcea indiscutabil vizibil - nu puteai să treci pe lângă ea, şi să nu spui "Bună ziua!" cu cel mai larg zâmbet; aşa cum nici nu se pune problema că ţi se răspundea cu un zâmbet şi mai larg. Totul era minuscul, dar impunător de la sine, fără să mă simt vreodată inferior.

Sau aşa cum spune o colegă de liceu, sau de fapt un alt suflet aplecat acum spre amintiri... "<span class="postbody">Doamna cu jacheta bej</span>".

Nici nu mai ştiu cum am cunoscut-o... Probabil în clasa a noua după o îndelungă perioadă de învăţ pentru Capacitate. Nici nu pot spune cât de bună a fost gura de aer proaspăt. O oră de română şi de gramatică în care parcă uşa clasei nu exista... nu existau elevi, nu exista profesor, nu tu bănci, nu tu catedră, nu tu manual. Poate sunt doar eu cu senzaţia asta, dar Doamne ce senzaţie. Întotdeauna cu catalogul pe prima bancă de pe rândul din mijloc, pe care câteodată o invidiam chiar şi pentru unicul motiv că devenise a ei.  Abia mai apoi mi-am dat seama că şi ultima bancă în care stăteam cu prietenul meu de-o viaţă aproape, Costy, era la fel de importantă ca şi prima. Nu conta că eşti "bun", nu conta că te doare-n cot de cum vorbeşti sau scrii, nu conta că citeşti o carte într-un an sau una într-o săptămână, nu conta absolut nimic în afară de relaţia om-om, care implica atâtea.. dar atâtea fără să-ţi dai seama, fără să te simţi obligat, fără să simţi că dai ceva de la tine, fără să simţi că primeşti ceva, deşi primeai atât de mult.

N-o să uit niciodată cum scriam la fiecare teză o filosofie curată, născută din faptul că nu reuşeam să mă asociez tuturor ideilor literare şi pentru că de fiecare dată ea era cea care mă făcea să mă simt că pot să gândesc pe cont propriu, că şi eu am dreptate în felul meu atâta timp cât nu încerc să prostesc pe nimeni... Atâta timp cât e o fărămă de silinţă. Câte şi mai câte întrebări îi puneam: că de ce aşa? da' de ce nu invers? că e mai logic aşa! da' cum adică nu tre' să fie logic?... şi câte explicaţii de mă durea pe mine capu' dădeam. Le mai şi nimeream :) Dar nu am auzit niciodată "Ai nimerit-o!" ci doar "Bravo! Aşa.."

Dar oare ştie cineva de ce adresa ei de E-mail este aparlea, când numele de familie este Pîrlea?... Pentru că un neştiutor, pe nume Andrei, în clasa a 9a, cu cămaşa albă cu mânecile suflecate, cu blugi, într-o oră în care cumva trăgea chiulul în laboratorul de info, unde un alt suflet cald, Ilie Cristina, a fost ok să lase calculatorul de la catedră ca neştiutorul să se pregătească pentru olimpiada de info... a fost rugat să-i facă o adresă de E-mail... şi care dintr-o vrere prea mare să nu greşească scrierea, a transformat şi numele după regula trecerii din î în â. Doar pentru că parcă nu vroiam să dezamăgesc... Şi pentru o secundă am fost, până s-a auzit "Nu contează. E foarte bine şi aşa. Mulţumesc mult. Hai nu fi trist, copil. Hai vin-o să te pup ca să-ţi mulţumesc. La ore acum, hai! Sau la chiul in laboratorul de info :)".

Şi uite-aşa am scris cu toţii pentru atâţia ani la aparlea@ ...

Şi oare cum să uit ce fericită a fost când am câştigat concursul grafic la aniversarea lui I.L. Caragiale?...

Sau oare cum să uit când ne-am strâns amândoi în camera mea, ca să corectăm un CD de prezentare al liceului? Când nu ştiam cum să formulăm frazele în engleză, şi ne hilizeam de parcă redescopeream lumea ...

Cum să uit atâtea...

Sunt prea multe, dar voi încerca să mi le amintesc pe toate, în cât mai multe detalii... măcar vei înţelege şi tu, cititorule, ce ai pierdut...

Semnat
"un mare clasic încă în viaţă" aşa cum m-a poreclit ea, şi cum cu fiecare ocazie sfârşeam orice frază mai filosofică... parcă pentru a-mi aminti că e o legătură între noi ce e doar una... la fel cum toţi cei care-am cunoscut-o am zis. Iar eu îi vorbeam pe nume, dar totuşi cu pronumele de politeţe...

Nu e nimic ce să-i ierte bunul Dumnezeu. Urăsc stereotipia frazei... Şi ea a evitat orice fel de cuvânt de genul ăsta când l-am pierdut eu pe tata... A început şi sfârşit cu un simplu "Cum te simţi, copil?"

Mă simt mai aplecat acum, Angelica, acum când cine ştie dacă cuvintele mai ajung la dvs. Dar sentimentul sigur ajunge! Simţiţi?

<a href="http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/angelica/picture-65jpg/" rel="attachment" title="picture-65.jpg"><img src="http://blog.andreineculau.com/2006/10/picture-65.jpg" alt="picture-65.jpg" /></a>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Bebé</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/angelica/bebe/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 18 Oct 2006 22:24:38 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/angelica/bebe/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[20061019

Am terminat ieri cu o poză pe care mulţi nu o pricep. Doar Ruxandra Badea şi ceilalţi dintre noi care făceau pregătire în camera viitorului bebé, în noul apartament de la Potcoava, ştiu poate ce e cu "muţunache". A apărut şi el la orizont, de departe, tocmai din Bratislava, Slovacia... aproape că n-aş putea spune pentru cine. Pentru ea, din cauză că se bucura atât de mult că bebeluşul va avea aşa ceva, sau pentru însuşi sufleţelul care în vara lui 2002 îşi avea viitorul departe dar cu siguranţă delimitat.

Încă de atunci, Angelica se gândea la un viitor copilaş... Nu conta ce va fi, răspunzând destul de ferm "Nu-i important. Sănătos şi-al meu să fie!" :) Întotdeauna parcă cu gândul că vremea trece şi copilul nu apare.

Aproape că mă gândeam de ce "se grăbeşte lent", pentru că parcă se ferea să nu dispară copilul/copilăria din ea... iar pentru mine era aşa clar că asta e imposibil. Nu pricepeam de ce graba. Aşa cum nu pricep nici acum graba de a pleca dintre noi...

Aşa cum nu pricep multe, dar probabil nu e nimic de priceput. Nu ştiu când, dar i-am spus odată de Einstein cugetând că e atât de multă ordine în această lume, încât trebuie să existe un Dumnezeu... iar ea replică subit "Şi totuşi trăim! :-) "

<a href="http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/?attachment_id=198" rel="attachment" title="picture-103.jpg"><img src="http://blog.andreineculau.com/2006/10/picture-103.jpg" alt="picture-103.jpg" /></a>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Cea mai recentă discuţie...</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/angelica/cea-mai-recenta-discutie/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 20 Oct 2006 16:49:15 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/angelica/cea-mai-recenta-discutie/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[20061020

Acum aproape un an (Decembrie 1, 2005) a plecat tatăl meu dintre noi. Am avut nevoie de mult spaţiu şi timp să mă reculeg într-un mod neştiut nici măcar de mine.

Prin luna Mai, când am mai marcat un an de viaţă în calendar, am anunţat lumea că există de acum încolo acest blog ca pagină personală... doar Dumnezeu îmi e martor că m-a străfulgerat când am adăugat-o la destinatari şi mi-am dat seama că trecuseră luni de când nu mai ştiam nimic.

Dar mi-a răspuns, în stilul ei original (cel puţin salutul era unul şi acelaşi peste tot... la mail, la telefon) :
<blockquote>ce mai faci, copilu/ nu te=am mai auzit de mult, eu voi fi mamica de fetita prin septembriem in rest toate cam la fel, sper ca esti ok,
angelica pirlea</blockquote>
Iar eu n-am ştiut ce se întâmplă. Nu părea adevărat. Era parcă prea frumos... Ştiam ce mult şi de ce multă vreme dorea un sufleţel.
<blockquote>Salutare...
mai multe de povestit, asa ca o s-o fac in vreo luna cand ma intorc in galati :)
deci fetita, nu? :)))))))))))))))))
BRAVO!</blockquote>
Dar m-am întors... aproape ca de obicei, n-am acordat atenţia cuvenită... m-am luat cu altele, şi n-am ajuns. M-am gândit de multe ori, dar n-am ajuns!

Şi uite-aşa s-a terminat şi vacanţa de vară. A trebuit să mă întorc la Bucureşti. A trebuit să plec din ţară. M-am reîntâlnit cu lume care o cunoştea de peste hotare, şi parcă cu un fior am vorbit de ea. Spuneam că au fost puţine persoane din şcoală care mi-au atins cumva persoana, şi nu intelectul... atât de puţine, încât degetele de la o mână erau chiar şi-aşa prea multe. Dar Angelica era fără doar şi poate în acea mână!

Doar doar dorinţa mea s-ar fi îndeplinit... devenise o promisiune bătută în cuie până în adâncuri. Să mă întorc în ţară, în Galaţi, şi să ne vedem... să-i văd pruncul. Dar într-o miercuri, cerul meu senin din Marea Mediterană a devenit un mare nor de n-am mai ştiu ce-i cu mine.

Parcă o aud şi-acum... într-o viteză care nu zicea "hai că n-am timp", ci doar "a trecut mult timp, aşa că hai să nu-l mai irosim", cu o voce care mă făcea să râd de fiecare dată... "Ce mai faci, copil?"

<a href="http://blog.andreineculau.com/2006/10/picture-127.jpg" title="picture-127.jpg"></a>
<p style="text-align:center;"><a href="http://blog.andreineculau.com/2006/10/picture-127.jpg" title="picture-127.jpg"><img src="http://blog.andreineculau.com/2006/10/picture-127.thumbnail.jpg" alt="picture-127.jpg" /></a></p>]]></content:encoded>

			<wp:comment_approved>1</wp:comment_approved>
			<wp:comment_type></wp:comment_type>

			<wp:comment_content><![CDATA[Te rog da mi un email. A fost diriginta mea doamna Parlea. Am vrb cu ea in mai, am venit in Romania in septembrie dar nu am cautat-o, am avut nunta shi alte probleme. Am aflat azi dimineatza ca deja a trecut un an :(. Am cautat toata ziua pe internet dar nu am gasit nimic. Vreau sa shtiu de ce s  aintamplat ceva atat de nedrept. Multzumesc]]></wp:comment_content>

	<item>
		<title>Şi viaţa de după</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/angelica/si-viata-de-dupa/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 24 Oct 2006 11:25:56 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/angelica/si-viata-de-dupa/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[20061022

Nu pot scrie despre momentul în care am văzut-o ieri pe Ilinca... Aproape că a fost ireal, aşa că cât mai curând posibil o să trebuiască să mă conving din nou de existenţa ei. :)

Cuvinte de genul "o minunăţie", "o frumuseţe", pălesc când o vezi sau când o auzi. O auzi rar, de parcă e atât de preţios ce vrea să spună că nu vrea să facă risipă. Şi cred şi eu că are ceva important să zică :) Vorbeşte doar când îi e fomiţă :)

...

Am stat cred că mai mult de-o oră cu telefonul în mână, şi nu reuşeam să formez numărul. Nu reuşeam pentru că îmi aminteam cum de fiecare dată apărea ideea (şi nu idea - Săru'mâna, Angelica!) de a o suna, înşfăcam telefonul şi numărul se forma singur parcă. Iar imediat se şi auzea "Ce faci, copil?".

Mă lovesc de salutul ăsta de fiecare dată pentru că deja mi s-au făcut cărări pe suprafaţa cerebrală, care-mi spun "Asta tre' să fie Angelica". De nenumărate ori după ce-am aflat nefericita veste, au fost momente când totul s-a clătinat în faţa mea. Am primit la un moment dat un mesaj de genul "[...] Totul bine, copil?[...]". Tot mesajul aproape fără context, şi pentru secunde bune, mi-a stat mintea în loc, gândindu-mă... "Asta e Angelica? Nu cumva e o farsă stupidă? Ştiu că nu se poate aşa ceva..."

Vă spun de pe-acum, tuturor că mă înscriu în cursa de a-i face orice naz Ilincăi... că sunteţi mulţi sau puţini cei care veţi face lucru acesta nu contează. Atât cât îi va fi îngăduit unui fost elev al mamei sale, îi voi fi alături. Mi-am luat măsuri de precauţie, vă avertizez :) Ştiu deja cam ce va purta peste o lună, dar şi peste 17 :) Am pornit deja cursa pentru a şti să citească... Şi nu doar în română, ci şi în franceză :)

... Şi totuşi, ieri eram speriat. Nu era parcă locul meu acolo. N-am venit niciodată fără să fie vreun motiv legat de Angelica. Şi totuşi de data asta Ilinca devenise motivul meu.

Nu cred că-şi poate imagina cineva cum e să treci pe sub catapeteasma de la intrare. Eu pot spune că nici acum n-am realizat nimic din ce s-a întâmplat. Stăteam în casă, şi vorbeam, şi parcă aşteptam să apară... dintr-o oră de pregătire, dintr-o vorbă cu muncitorii care parcă deveniseră parte stabilă a locului cu pricina, de undeva. De oriunde!

Ceva îmi răsună în minte şi-mi spune nu-i adevărat. E ceva atât de puternic, că nici o altă voce nu o străpunge. Până şi acasă domnea o linişte deloc apăsătoare. Nu cred să fi fost nici copilaşul, nu cred să fi fost nimic altceva decât tăria celor din casă. O tărie care nu mi-a imprimat nici lipsa suferinţei, nici lipsa recunoştinţei, nici lipsa bucuriei pentru cea mică... O tărie aproape tacită, ca şi cum aş fi auzit-o pe Angelica înainte şi după moartea tatălui meu.

N-am să uit cum ea a fost primul şi ultimul om care nu mi-a spus de condoleanţe sau altele, ci m-a întrebat la fel "Ce faci, copil?", şi fiind mai clară imediat "Cum te simţi?". Îmi aduc aminte, sau... nu-mi aduc aminte nici un moment în care să se fi plâns de ceva la modul real. Vorbeam la telefon de poziţia ei educativă la liceu, de zidarii care nu mai plecau de la ea din casă, de lucrarea ei de grad, de câte şi mai câte... Putea să fie extaziată, sau supărată, în plină forţă sau obosită, dar niciodată Jos.

Jos - n-am găsit-o niciodată. Poate cei apropiaţi o ştiu şi aşa, deşi mi-e greu să-mi imaginez o situaţie de gen. Era o luptătoare fără să fie înverşunată, fără să fie împinsă de supărări, de motive stupide. Aproape că lupta pentru tot cei mai bun în viaţa asta.

Ziceam că mă duceam acasă la ea întotdeauna pentru ea. Şi, inconştient, am crezut că nimic din toate acestea nu voi găsi acum acasă. Dar din contră. Acelaşi iz de "Cum ne simţim noi oare? S-a întâmplat cu adevărat, şi am vrea, dar ştim că nu se poate, să întoarcem timpul înapoi. Şi totuşi ce facem noi în continuare?" N-am auzit decât "avem atâtea momente frumoase împreună", "acum e asta mică", "aveam planuri pentru următorii 30 de ani". Totul parcă se limita la ce frumos a fost şi cum facem să fie măcar bine de acum în colo pentru noi, cei mari, şi măcar la fel de frumos pentru Ilinca.

O înţelegere de sine care mie mi-a lipsit acum un an. M-am întors la ale mele, în încercarea nebună să mă pun pe picioare, ca după doar câteva luni, mintea să-mi spună "Stop!"

... La locul unde s-ar presupune că e acum Angelica, nu e ea. E doar un morman de coroane şi flori care aproape că o întrec în înălţime, care nu mi-a inspirat decât "Uite câţi suntem, câţi am cunoscut o bucăţică din tine, şi câţi ne gândim la tine!" Au început să curgă amintiri, imagini, vorbe... dar ca de fiecare dată, nu era nimic greu.

Aşa că, nu ştiu unde eşti Angelica, dar pe lumea cealaltă nu eşti cu siguranţă.

Nu ştiu unde îţi petreci o vacanţă departe de tot şi toate. Nu ştiu dacă e Suedia sau doar apartamentul cu priveliştea de care Ilinca o să se minuneză în câţiva ani... nu ştiu dacă vrei să mai aştept în faţa magazinului, nu ştiu dacă îmi cauţi un tricou nou, nu ştiu dacă eşti în căutare de bucurii pentru cea mică. Nu ştiu multe.

Dar ştiu că eşti în aceeaşi stare în care eram cu tine acum 5 ani... cu soarele pe noi ca o pătură, râzând unul de altul de cât de scăpaţi de sub control este celălalt, fără întrebări de genul "Şi dacă vine poliţia?", doar cu răspunsuri ca "Ei şi ce?"...
<p align="center">... cu picioarele desculţe, cu încălţările în mână, făcând cu mâna la toţi care ne priveau din maşină, şi cu greu trezindu-ne să avem măcar o fotografie cu noi în "halul" ăla.</p>
<p align="center"><a href="http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/036jpg/" rel="attachment" title="036.jpg"><img src="http://blog.andreineculau.com/2006/10/036.jpg" alt="036.jpg" /></a></p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>206</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2006-10-24 13:25:56</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2006-10-24 11:25:56</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>si-viata-de-dupa</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>private</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>195</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>110</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>page</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Erasmus</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/erasmus/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 28 Nov 2006 11:22:11 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/erasmus/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[I'm planning to have a tiny, yet very straight-forward tutorial on what steps you need to take in order to get a mobility grant and become an Erasmus Exchange Student (EES).

Since a virtual example is good, but not complete, I will simply keep track of what I've been through to achieve this, and how are things going from now on. Good enough?
<blockquote>There's also an Erasmus Romanian girl that I found out about, that is writing about her experiences (mostly in Romanian) - Andreea Retea. Check her out at <a href="http://www.andressa.ro" target="_blank">www.andressa.ro</a> (easier to follow <a href="http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2006/11/29/cum-e-sa-fii-erasmus/">here</a>).</blockquote>
The first thing you should do is to visit the ERASMUS homepage by <a href="http://ec.europa.eu/education/programmes/socrates/erasmus/students_en.html" target="_blank">clicking here</a>.

You'll get the basic information from its own page. You might want to try also the UK Erasmus located <a href="http://www.erasmus.ac.uk/" target="_blank">here</a> or the Erasmus Students Network located <a href="http://www.esn.org/" target="_blank">here</a>.

Now - the basic information should simply start with whether you have an ongoing Erasmus programme at your university or not. You can find this out at the Department of International Relations (DIR) at your home university, or even inside your faculty, since some faculties have separate offices.

If you have such a programme, then there should be a schedule for enrolling at the contest. The scheduling and the rules of the contest are totally up to DIR. It depends on what type of students your university wants to send out.

Before I go any further, a pretty darn good advice is to keep your breath, be strong and consistent in the pursuit of your goal to become an EES. Different obstacles would be lack of organization on both sides, lack of will to send "your type of a student", etc. It is somewhat up to you to stand out in order to make sure you get this scholarship.
<h2>Before the Contest</h2>
At my university there was a contest in May-June 2006. I will simply highlight that by that time other students, in Bucharest and not only, already sat the examination and knew the full details of their exchange period. This is also due to the fact that some scholarships are for a full year, some for the winter semester (1st), and some for the summer semester (2nd).

If they don't give you exact dates of the contest, then just keep nagging the people at DIR whenever you feel the need! (not a joke)

Once you know the dates, then prepare yourself. Usually such a contest is not a written examination, but more or less a dossier contest, followed maybe by a language examination. To be specific about my situation, the dossier included
<ul>
	<li><strong>Curriculum Vitae</strong> (Resumé)
You can have this in your own format or you can choose the <a href="http://europass.cedefop.europa.eu/europass/home/vernav/Europasss+Documents/Europass+CV/navigate.action" target="_blank">Europass CV</a>. It is up to you and the rules of the contest held at your home university.
<strong>My CV looks like <a href="http://blog.andreineculau.com/2006/11/curriculum-vitae-andrei-neculau.pdf" title="My Curriculum Vitae - Nov 3 - 2006">this</a> [PDF version].</strong></li>
	<li><strong>Letter of Intention/Motivation</strong>
It should be addressed to your DIR, and should touch these topics: who you are as an individual (present, past, life goals) and as a student (curricula, educational desires), why you would like to be part of the Erasmus and why you should be considered as a prospect EES. This letter doesn't have any strict rules. Just be clear, use strong words and try to create a large picture of your goal. As a minor thing: don't forget to sign it if you typed it on your computer. It will give an honest and personal touch to the letter.
<strong>My LM looked like <a href="http://blog.andreineculau.com/2006/11/letter-of-motivation-erasmus-application.pdf" title="Letter of Motivation (Contest Application)">this</a> [PDF version].</strong></li>
	<li><strong>Application Form</strong>
A form provided by your DIR that should contain personal and educational information and status, and also your choices concerning which universities you would like to go to. A list of options should be given to you in advance, along with information about the future courses.</li>
	<li><strong>Transcript of Records</strong>
This is provided by the Secretary at your faculty, without any fee since it is needed inside your home university. This should be in the homeland's language.</li>
	<li>Depending on the language you will take the courses in, you might be asked for a <strong>Language Certificate</strong>. In my situation, a certificate in a widely-spread language was enough (English, French, German, Spanish). Others, without a certificate, had to sit an exam in English.</li>
</ul>
Pay attention to the day when the results of the contest will be made public. Depending on your results you might get chosen or you might be a secondary man. In case some of the chosen people rejects the place, you will be chosen instead of him/her.

Again, you might encounter difficulties in getting your information. Like I said before, just keep nagging them! Some institutions are less transparent about this issue. That's why you need to stick to their tail. Don't wait for things to come in your face.

The moment you know that you were chosen and have DIR's support to get you an Erasmus scholarship, you should act as quickly as possible.
<h2>After the Contest</h2>
One of the most important things is to get a contact person at your foreign university along with her/his E-mail address. Start searching for information about the foreign university's Erasmus programme - the easiest way is to google for it (e.g. "erasmus academy of humanities and economics lodz poland"); some universities don't have their websites connected to the section that concerns the Erasmus programme.

On that respective website you will need to find the following information:
<ul>
	<li><strong>Documents</strong> needed to be filled in - these are mostly based on some general templates, but you are advised to use their personalised documents. Usually there are 4 documents: <strong>Student Application Form</strong>, <strong>Learning Agreement</strong>, <strong>Accommodation Form</strong>, <strong>Transcript of Records</strong>. The full list of documents also include a <strong>Letter of Motivation</strong> and your <strong>Curriculum Vitae</strong> (usually as in the Europass format).
<strong>General Templates</strong> (PDF format): <a href="http://blog.andreineculau.com/2006/11/student-application-form.pdf" title="Student Application Form">Student Application Form</a>, <a href="http://blog.andreineculau.com/2006/11/learning-agreement.pdf" title="Learning Agreement">Learning Agreement</a>, <a href="http://blog.andreineculau.com/2006/11/transcript-of-records.pdf" title="Transcript of Records">Transcript of Records</a></li>
	<li><strong>Available courses</strong> for EES -the websites should also provide courses' codes that you need to fill in the Learning Agreement form. Not all courses that run at the hosting university are available to you, as an EES. Some courses are also provided in a foreign language, other than the native language of the hosting country.</li>
	<li><strong>Study period</strong>. It is different for each university, for each country.</li>
	<li><strong>Deadline for submitting the documents</strong>. Usually there are two deadlines: one for the summer and one for the winter semester. Be aware that in this timespan you will also need to get a confirmation from the hosting university.</li>
	<li><strong>Fax number and snail mail address</strong> for submitting the documents. You are advised to post the documents in such a way that you get a confirmation of arrival, and if you are little on time, you should use Express mail so that the papers arrive faster.</li>
</ul>
I have told you to be patient and also consistent in your strive to give others a push. I have told you to do that with your DIR, but the same thing needs to be done with the hosting institution's DIR. You might find yourself waiting a week for a reply to your email, with questions about the hosting institution's programme.

Please be aware that some people are willing to help you in the best way they can, but they are busy as well. Don't be pushy or disrespectful, but only consistent in your efforts.
<h3>Student Application Form</h3>
The <strong>Student Application Form</strong> is quite easy to fill in. Be aware that the Department Coordinator can be your dean or the man in charge with the Erasmus programme inside your faculty (also referenced as "department"). The Institutional Coordinator can be your rector or the man in charge with the Erasmus programme inside your university, or the man in charge of DIR. Ask before you fill in these fields and find out their fax, telephone numbers and E-mail address. You should expect 30 ECTS credit, though I know you can take up between 20 and 36 credits.

Examples of SAF. <strong>My SAF looks like <a href="http://blog.andreineculau.com/2006/11/andrei_neculau_wshe_student_application_form.pdf" title="SAF_eg1">this</a>.</strong> Another example from the Erasmus website looks like <a href="http://blog.andreineculau.com/2006/11/example1.pdf" title="SAF_eg2">this</a>.
<h3>Learning Agreement</h3>
The <strong>Learning Agreement</strong> is also quite clear. Just check the available courses at your host university, and fill in with your preferences, and then get a green light from your dean. Some courses that you take at your host university might be recognized as equivalent courses that you should have been taking at your home university during the exchange period. Therefore, when you get back home, you will only have to sit the rest of the examinations.

Depending on the host university's system, you might have to choose more courses than the number of needed ECTS credits. Some courses can only be held if there is a consistent number of students, therefore consult with the contact person to see if you should choose more courses or not.

Examples of LA. <strong>My LA looks like <a href="http://blog.andreineculau.com/2006/11/andrei_neculau_wshe_learning_agreement.pdf" title="LA_eg1">this</a>.</strong> Another examples from the Erasmus website looks like <a href="http://blog.andreineculau.com/2006/11/example2.pdf" title="LA_eg2">this</a>.
<h3>Transcript of Records</h3>
The <strong>Transcript of Records</strong> is probably the most difficult to fill in. Not because it is unclear, but because you need to grab hand of your home university's ECTS courses and their codes. This might be quite difficult, but remember: it is your right and need to fill in this. You might get lucky and your Secretary will do this for you though. Each university enrolled in the Erasmus programme must have a booklet of some kind describing their courses and ECTS credits in association with homeland grades.

Examples of TR. <strong>My TR looks like <a href="http://blog.andreineculau.com/2006/11/andrei_neculau_wshe_transcript_of_records.pdf" title="TR_eg1">this</a>.</strong> Another examples from the Erasmus website looks like <a href="http://blog.andreineculau.com/2006/11/example3.pdf" title="TR_eg2">this</a>.
<h3>Letter of Motivation
and Accommodation Request</h3>
Then there is the Letter of Motivation (<strong>mine looks like <a href="http://blog.andreineculau.com/2006/11/letter-of-motivation-erasmus-host-university.pdf" title="Letter of Motivation (Hosting Institution)">this</a></strong>) and the Accommodation Form (<strong>mine looks like <a href="http://blog.andreineculau.com/2006/11/andrei_neculau_wshe_accommodation_request.pdf" title="Accomodation Request">this</a></strong>).

When you have all the papers ready, you should get them all signed, then quickly fax them and mail them.

Now wait for a confirmation letter from the hosting institution. You should now sign the contract for the mobility grant.

Get an <strong>International Student Identity Card (ISIC)</strong> and/or an <strong>Euro26 Card</strong>. Visit <a href="www.isic.org" target="_blank">www.isic.org</a> and <a href="www.euro26.org" target="_blank">www.euro26.org</a> to see which is the right one for you (check the discounts provided in the town where your hosting university is) and how to get it in your home country.

<strong>Don't forget to plan you trip as well</strong>. Some universities aren't that easy to reach, therefore try to find the most cheap way to get to a major nearby city, because you might have extra expenditures from that city to the university's city. I recommend trying to find a flight through <a href="www.skyscanner.net" target="_blank">www.skyscanner.net</a> (Cheap Flight search engine). You can try to find a connection flight as well, as long as you give yourself at least a 5 hours stay in the connection airport. Please remember that cheap flight aren't meant for this, and they do not provide any insurance for this, but nowadays cheap flights are quite reliable.

This is where my story is put on hold, and therefore this tutorial as well.

<strike>(to be continued...)</strike> <strong>My Erasmus Experience was blogged at <a href="http://desiderius.wordpress.com">http://desiderius.wordpress.com</a></strong>]]></content:encoded>

			<wp:comment_approved>1</wp:comment_approved>
			<wp:comment_type></wp:comment_type>
			<wp:comment_parent>0</wp:comment_parent>
			<wp:comment_user_id>0</wp:comment_user_id>
		</wp:comment>
		<wp:comment>
			<wp:comment_id>211</wp:comment_id>
			<wp:comment_author><![CDATA[Iheanacho henry]]></wp:comment_author>
			<wp:comment_author_email>blessedhenry200@yahoo.com</wp:comment_author_email>
			<wp:comment_author_url></wp:comment_author_url>
			<wp:comment_author_IP>41.219.214.95</wp:comment_author_IP>
			<wp:comment_date>2008-05-09 13:23:09</wp:comment_date>
			<wp:comment_date_gmt>2008-05-09 11:23:09</wp:comment_date_gmt>
			<wp:comment_content><![CDATA[hope to hear from u .

	<item>
		<title>Toefl</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/toefl/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 31 Dec 2007 21:38:59 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/toefl/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<div style="background:red;color:white;padding:5px;">Since April 12, 2008 this page is obsolete.
Please follow the link to get updates on this topic.</div>
<div style="border:1px solid red;padding:5px;">This topic has moved to <a href="http://andreineculau.com/go/toefl/">http://andreineculau.com/go/toefl/</a> .</div>
* Upon taking the test you actually give you're consent never to spread out the contents of your test, but make no mistake! The following is only a step-by-step guide and a feeling description.

This is merely a follow-up after my first attempt to make it easier for others. <a href="http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/erasmus/">The first attempt was about becoming/being an Erasmus.</a>

Now I'm "holding your hand" or head, if you will, before you take the TOEFL examination.

First of all... <strong>TOEFL = Test Of English as a Foreign Language</strong>! :D Bingo!

Now that we had that all sorted out, you need to know that there are multiple types of Toefl. It is just an evolution of things: <strong>PBT</strong> - paper based test, <strong>CBT</strong> - computer based test and <strong>iBT</strong> - Internet based test.

If you are going to have the test in a fairly big city, you are going to work on the iBT version of it. iBT simply means that not only you will work with a computer and your input will be digitized, but your work will also automatically go to TOEFL authenticated servers through a secure communication.

Every version has different standards for grading, but I'm going to talk about just the <strong>iBT version. This one has a maximum of 120!</strong> At average universities you will need a minimum of 80 points in order for your level of English to be alright with the course needs.

The test is divided as the Cambridge, and mostly any other language test, may it be English or not, into 4 sections: <strong>Reading, Listening, Speaking and Writing</strong>.

<em>Reading</em> is nothing more than reading a piece of text within a time span, then answering questions showing that you understood what you've just read. The peculiar thing is that although the reading and answering parts are timed, while you are answering you have multiple choices to pick from, and also you have the paragraph/sentence that is referenced by the question highlighted. Almost no memory, nor logic skills involved.

<em>Listening</em> provides short speeches and then you need to answer quite simple questions.

<em>Speaking</em> is made up of different questions that you need to answer orally. What's peculiar about this section is that you have about 30 seconds to think about your answer, and then 30 seconds to talk.

<em>Writing</em> is all about two pieces of text that you need to formulate. While one is a bit more static, because you need to reference another static text, and sum it up with your own words, the other is more dynamic by making you provide your own perspective.

<strong>Now, it all sounds crispy clear, right? But it's not that easy!</strong>

Both the <em>Reading</em> and <em>Listening</em> are tricky, or at least I found them to be. While they seem to be so helpful (providing the text, highlighting the paragraph that the question references, multiple choice, etc), the right answer is a bit tricky to find. I mean it's like having that angel and devil on each of your shoulder... which one to choose, flip a coin.. The multiple choices are really really close sometimes, and you basically need a lot of... English spirit, I would call it. Lots of reading, lots of movies, lots of socializing to get to know all the right nuances and synonyms.

Now don't worry, ya! There's plenty of that during <em>Speaking</em>. Now how the hell are you supposed to answer to some quite complex questions in 30 seconds. I personally found myself really cornered! During those 30 seconds of thinking before each answer, I was only jogging down words... not day-to-day words, but a bit over-the-hand words just so I can say what's on my mind, the way I want it, while still being correct and exact in only 30 seconds.

<em>Writing</em> was the easiest part. All you had to do was to follow the guidelines that you can find out in the online demo. Just follow that specific structure, and you're ok.

So basically, I think TOEFL was a course with obstacles. It was not the regular.. lets see what you know. Instead it felt more like... lets see how tough you are.

I got 108 out of 120, a score of which I'm quite proud. But what was weird was that I lost points at Speaking and Writing because... wait to hear this.. because I used phrases or words that were too colloquial. Well, blow me for trying to do the best I could!

Anyway... <strong>my advice for TOEFL</strong>, just hold still and treat it as if you were the best English speaker ever. Just prepare your mind to think that you've got 150 points at your disposal, and you only need half of them.

Concerning<strong> the procedures</strong>... well, you need to register online at least two weeks before the test date. Otherwise you will pay more. But you should register even earlier anyway, so that you can assure you have a seat, if you are cramped and eager to get your results. At the test center you will have a photo taken, so you might want to go for something casual but decent, no matter how hot or cold it is outside.

Be prepared - there's only a 10 minutes break after 2 hours, and you'll have two more hours. While theoretically you can use that time to take a piss, imagine that all the others being tested will want to take a piss, so you might want to cut down on liquids two hours before the test. And also you can use those 10 minutes to flirt - I can't say that I flirted, but I did have a small talk with a nice curly brunette. I have to say that I'm really sorry I didn't get her name, nor her phone number. She seemed nice, although she was targeting the US :(

When you finish your last section, pay attention to what you're doing. You will be asked if you want to send your input for analysis, or if you want to cancel it - most probably because you it didn't go as you expected and because there's a minimum period of time between tests (I am only assuming here, so you figure it out). It is also a way to stop having your results being sent to the institutions that you marked upon registering to the exam.

<strong>Results</strong> will be available online after 15 working days. In the meantime you will have no other results. Be aware that 15 working days means 3 full weeks. Online you can see a list of dates when they will also mail you the certificate through regular post. Mine got to me earlier, but don't count on that. So whenever you have the deadline, leave 3 weeks for results and another 3 weeks for receiving the paper certificate, in case you also need to have an original paper with you. Most institutions require that you submit your score directly from TOEFL.

That's it! Break a leg! Hope this was useful!]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Keyboard</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/keyboard/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 17 Jan 2008 23:56:10 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/keyboard/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[For some years now, I've been using a modified driver for my Swedish/Finnish laptop keyboard in order to access Romanian diacritics without changing the placement of special characters.

A while back (January 2008) I published that driver. Now I'm publishing a whole set of modified drivers for Windows Keyboard Layouts that support Romanian diacritics.

I have a strong belief that Keyboard layouts should be a little bit unified. Only in a perfect world will you find keyboards for each and every possible language. Since that doesn't happen, you most often buy US keyboards and then apply your language's keyboard layout driver, but that mixes up special characters like apostrophes, quotes, dash, hash, etc. and you get all confused.

Before you go on looking at the builds I'm making available, you should know that they do not respect the standards (quite obvious). The only base rules that they follow are:
<ol>
	<li>support Romanian diacritics without changing other (at at least not too many) keys that you see on the physical keyboard</li>
	<li>provide access to the Romanian diacritics by following as close as possible the <i>Programmers </i>(dead-key + base letter) or <i>Standard </i>layout (keys closest to the left of ENTER)</li>
</ol>
All the builds incorporate the correct diacritics - ș and ț (with comma bellow) - and not the Windows legacy ones - ş and ţ (with cedilla bellow).

Having said these, lets cut to the <strike>chase</strike> downloads.
<ol>
	<li><a href="http://andreineculau.deviantart.com/art/Romanian-for-Swedish-Keyboard-74893555"><b>Swedish/Finnish</b> keyboard</a>
Close to <i>Romanian (Standard)</i> layout
Adds support for Polish diacritics as well. Full article with more information <a href="http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2008/01/11/romanian-for-swedish-layout/">here</a>.</li>
	<li><a href="http://andreineculau.deviantart.com/art/Romanian-for-French-Keyboard-74893835"><b>French </b>keyboard</a>
Similar to <i>Romanian (Standard)</i> layout. Difference: AltGr combination</li>
	<li><a href="http://andreineculau.deviantart.com/art/Romanian-for-UK-Keyboard-74816698"><b>UK (British)</b> keyboard</a>
Similar to <i>Romanian (Standard)</i> layout. Difference: AltGr combination</li>
	<li><a href="http://andreineculau.deviantart.com/art/Romanian-for-Spanish-Keyboard-74816399"><b>Spanish </b>keyboard</a>
Close to <i>Romanian (Programmers)</i> layout</li>
	<li><a href="http://andreineculau.deviantart.com/art/Romanian-for-Italian-Keyboard-74815980"><b>Italian </b>keyboard</a>
Close to <i>Romanian (Programmers)</i> layout</li>
</ol>
Looking forward to read your comments!]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>WWW - Why, Why, Why? -- INTRODUCTION</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/2005/08/www-why-why-why-introduction/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 19 Aug 2005 23:16:00 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2005/08/20/www-why-why-why-introduction/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Firstly, I'd like to tell you Why.. Mainly because I sometimes (not always, and that feels reliefing) I get so many things in my head.. sometimes about important stuff, sometimes about the little things in our day-to-day life that seem to make the world go round..

Secondly, you must be wondering "Why?", so I'm going to give you an insight. Because just sometimes you feel like there has to be some sense inside the nonsense that you're thinking. There has to be!

Last, but not least, you probably got stuck with Why. It's not that I have so many genius-like thoughts, but what if somebody else has one, while reading my lines? Then, maybe it wasn't all in vain.

P.S. Why some things are (actually will be) in Romanian?.. Just simply because sometimes you have to swear in your native language!]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>www-why-why-why-introduction</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>publish</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>post</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>

	<item>
		<title>Where do I belong to - English</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/2005/09/where-do-i-belong-to-english/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 29 Sep 2005 19:06:05 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2005/09/29/where-do-i-belong-to-english/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Where do I belong to?
<strong>September 2005, Brno, Czech Republic</strong>

Identity is very important, no matter how old we are. For us, the youth, it is even more important due to the fact that we are trying new things, experiencing different places and meeting people from many social, cultural, etc. backgrounds. Such experiences help us in finding ourselves.

From the 10th of September until the 20th of September 2005, an international group had the chance to be part of all those previously mentioned, taking part in a variety of activities, inside a project called “Where do I belong to?”, near the city of Brno, Czech Republic. The group was made out of 5 countries, that is Poland, United Kingdom, Italy, Czech Republic, and of course Romania, each of them represented by 8 students and a group leader.

The project took place in 3 different locations: the city of Brno, a lovely university town, with several choices of activities, with great cultural diversity; a mountain camp, near Podhradi nad Dyji, a location pretty much isolated, where the main noise was due to the nearby river; and the Velke Bilovice village, where tradition was an understatement, without having any trail of aging.

In order to assist the identity-image building, along with testing different locations, each participant had the chance to build a “body” that reflects his/her own person. Taken from upside down, this “body” starts with a straw hat, designed and manually built by each of us. Nobody thought that the patterns will be so different one from the other. The follows a T-shirt, colored after each personality. And interesting observation came from those who assisted us with all these handy-crafts: many T-shirts were full of colors, meaning that people were still looking their own way in life, even though many were in their last year of university, and the prejudice is to believe that all of them have already self-defined themselves.

As a more obvious link to the time spent in Czech Republic, the part of pants, which used recycled newspapers by each of us, included photos of us highlighting each participant in different situations. I skipped one element, due to strong reasons. The plaster mask! Yes, it’s true. Although many people hesitated at first, finally the majority had one-to-one copies of their own faces. The experience is unique, and impossible to put into words, bringing out fears, trust in others, new sensations and also an unseen way to “frame” your own face.

With respect to testing the three locations, the activities have been specific to each of them. Hence, in the mountains there were sports, along with clearing the path towards the camp. The village Velke Bilovice offered the possibility of living a day of work in the orchard and in a wine yard, but we also took part at a wine celebration, an old tradition of the region, along with wine tasting and learning to dance polka. I need to stress out the situation of foreigners in Brno, which we also checked out. We had to test the city concerning its facilities offered to foreigners by the local institutions, and also by the inhabitants of the city with their level of speaking an international language. It is already too much, but I cannot forget about the visit to the Brno Automotodrom, where he were able to drive go-karts and be part of a special tour of the whole circuit, rolling down straight on the track.

I cannot forget about the national evenings either, where each group shared a bit of its culture and its national life as a whole. We were neck at neck with the Czechs at the national evenings spent in the village. You shall decide if a Romanian movie, followed by hominy with cheese and sour-cream, along with eggs and Maria Tanase (traditional old music) is higher or not than a Czech winery, with specific songs, and a great finale, which was tasting more than seven types of wine.

One last aspect needs to be highlighted, which is without a doubt one of the first in its importance. This type of international projects gives the possibility to build links between the involved institutions. Therefore, the students of the Romanian-American University had the chance to meet those of the University of East Anglia, Norwich, United Kingdom, those of the University of Studies, Sassari, Italy, and of course those of the Sting Academy, Brno, Czech Rep. Beginning with this moment, the horizon has considerably enlarged.

In the name of each participant, we thank the organizing Czech group, that is Antonin Schneider, Savina Finardi, Lukas Trcka, Jirina Krobova, Zuzana Valesova, Lenka Holeckova, Aneta Petrova, Pavla Vitkova, Milan Vyhnak and also David, Itka and Mirek.

Participants of the Romanian-American University:
Ruxandra Teodoru,     Mihai Homorozeanu,
Vlad Andronescu,     Dragoş Pop,
and     Estera Piroşcă.

Group Leader:
Andrei Neculau

Contact Information:
Website – <a href="http://www.towheredoibelong.euweb.cz/">www.towheredoibelong.euweb.cz</a>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Multiple websites using IIS 5.1 on Windows XP</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/2006/01/multiple-websites-using-iis-51-on-windows-xp/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 23 Jan 2006 14:37:00 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2006/01/23/multiple-websites-using-iis-51-on-windows-xp/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Ever wondered how you can set up multiple websites in Windows XP (i.e. Proffesional)?
Did you wonder at least if it possible?

Well, it is. Microsoft has it’s own way of hiding things…from novice users, so that the system will not crash down… Hmm, just a small thought: is this how you should protect something? By not letting people get their hands on all of it?

Another small thought: Microsoft is more like…building this car, lots and lots of advertising to gather a big percentage of the market, you buy it, looks very nice with all those visual styles…iuhuu! :) …then, when something goes wrong with the car..and you just want to take a peak….uppps!… The hood is locked.
But still, Microsoft is Microsoft and few wackos can deny this…

Back to our stuff.
Inside the INETPUB folder that Windows XP creates when installing IIS, there’s a folder called ADMINSCRIPTS…
Open a Command Prompt in that folder.
By typing “<strong>adsutil.vbs enum w3svc /p</strong>” you will get a list of websites created. Basically only the Default Website (W3SVC/1)

To create a new one, type
“<strong>adsutil.vbs create_vserv W3SVC/2</strong>” (the last number can be anything; it is the index of the new website)
“<strong>adsutil.vbs copy W3SVC/1 W3SVC/2</strong>”
and go to the Internet Information Services/Computer Management and rename this new website, give it a new root folder and set it up however you like.

To delete one, type
“<strong>adsutil.vbs delete W3SVC/2</strong>”

What you have to remember is that in Windows XP, you can only have one, and only one website running.

Of course, there is a simpler way – free software:
<a href="http://www.firstserved.net/services/iisadmin.php">http://www.firstserved.net/services/iisadmin.php</a>
<a href="http://jetstat.com/iisadmin/">http://jetstat.com/iisadmin/</a>

You can also try <a href="http://www.hairy-spider.com/multisite.aspx">http://www.hairy-spider.com/multisite.aspx</a>, which is an ISAPI filter that can associate different domains to 127.0.0.1 and differenciates requests through that. It doesn’t deliver website alternative configuration though.]]></content:encoded>

	</item>
	<item>
		<title>IIS Multiple ASP Requests gets your application into stalling</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/2006/01/iis-multiple-asp-requests-gets-your-application-into-stalling/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 23 Jan 2006 19:32:31 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2006/01/23/iis-multiple-asp-requests-gets-your-application-into-stalling/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[If you’ve tried at least once to use CDO’s procedure called CreateMHTMLBody and passed another local ASP script as parameter… and that got you waiting for a couple of minutes before receiving a message saying “Operation aborted” due to timeout, then here’s the reason.

You probably have activated the ASP server-side debugging.
And, as every IT proffesional does, you didn’t read what that means exactly, by clicking on Help.

When you activate this option you will get your requests into single-thread mode, in order to get the debugger attached to the process. That means that the server respondes to only one request at a time. If a second request is made, it is being made secondary, and has to wait for the first to finish, and then it will get processed.

By using CreateMHTMLBody “<strong>http://localhost/script2.asp</strong>” from “<strong>script1.asp</strong>” you are initiating a second request. But this second request has to wait for “<strong>script1.asp</strong>” to finish, which in turn expects a reply from “<strong>script2.asp</strong>”…therefore the “dog running for its tail” situation.

The same situation will happen if you use the XMLHTTP object, or any other object that initiates a second request to the same server, and I may add same application. I am not sure, but it would be logical to be able to do that if you’re using a different application with High (Isolated) Application Protection, thus having a different thread.]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>34</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2006-01-23 21:32:31</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2006-01-23 19:32:31</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>iis-multiple-asp-requests-gets-your-application-into-stalling</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>publish</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>post</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>

	<item>
		<title>Debug ASP with Microsoft Script Editor (that comes with Office XP)</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/2006/01/debug-asp-with-microsoft-script-editor-that-comes-with-office-xp/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 23 Jan 2006 22:11:08 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2006/01/24/debug-asp-with-microsoft-script-editor-that-comes-with-office-xp/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Pff…..today, after working a way out of a crazy thread-related situation (when you have debugging enabled, you have a single-thread situation on your IIS server)….

I have also found a way out of another crazy situation!
Setting Microsoft Script Editor to debug ASP once again!

I don’t need any fancy debugger, and I don’t actually enjoy Visual Studio, so the Script Editor that comes with Office XP is the best thing for me. It gives me a perspective on local variables when the error comes up, loads fast, it doesn’t let me modify sources (which is good – I’m modifying them only in my coding environment), let’s you stop the process safely.

Setting it up again… believe you ME… it wasn’t easy at all!
After “playing” with the Machine Debug Manager and reinstalling IIS over and over again…I found the solution. It is funny that I had to search everywhere and try everything… There’s almost no post on the Internet about it. Microsoft has one (article 814714).. entitled &lt;&lt;PRB: "Jview.exe Failed to Launch" Error Message When You Debug a Visual J++ Application After You Remove Office XP&gt;&gt; — very hard to find.

Stop your World Wide Web Publishing, and Machine Debug Manager from the Services window.

Now, find “<strong>vs7jit.exe</strong>”, usually in Program Files\Common Files\Microsoft Shared\Vs7debug
At the Command Prompt, type “<strong>vs7jit.exe /regserver</strong>”. This will set it up.

In the Internet Information Services, check that your application configuration has enabled server-side/client-side debugging. Do not start the application (website).

Now start the Machine Debug Manager again. Then the World Wide Web Publishing.

Pfiu. That does it!]]></content:encoded>

		<title>Still ASP &amp; IIS - Locale</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/2006/01/still-asp-iis-locale/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 24 Jan 2006 22:24:28 +0000</pubDate>

Otherwise, you will reset the CodePage by setting LCID

For example, I set 65001 as CodePage (UTF-8), then 2057 as LCID, as in UK English. But then UTF8 characters weren’t displayed correctly.]]></content:encoded>
