	<item>
		<title>Romanian for Swedish Layout</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/2008/01/romanian-for-swedish-layout/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 11 Jan 2008 17:09:43 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2008/01/11/romanian-for-swedish-layout/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<b><a href="http://andreineculau.deviantart.com/art/Romanian-for-Swedish-Keyboard-74893555">DOWNLOAD HERE</a></b>

This is the keyboard driver I'm using on my Vista. I've been using it for ~2 years now, on XP as well. It works more than fine for me, since I am using it to write in Romanian quite often. I was in Poland for some months, and that's why the driver has a dead key for building Polish diacritics.

The reason behind building this was the fact that the Swedish/Finnish layout has major differences from the US-International layout, and implicitly from the Romanian layout. Therefore it is highly annoying to guess where are is, for instance, " [quotes] while you look at a Swedish/Finnish keyboard with a Romanian driver. (It's on the ~).

Hopefully this will be useful for others who need both Swedish/Finnish and Romanian diacritics on the same Swedish/Finnish keyboard.

<b>Basics</b> - keeps all the Swedish/Finnish keys, except the following:
<ul>
	<li>ö becomes ș (S with <b>comma</b> bellow - legacy)</li>
	<li>ä becomes ț (T with <b>comma</b> bellow - legacy)</li>
	<li>' becomes â</li>
	<li>å becomes ă</li>
	<li>¨ becomes î</li>
	<li>´ becomes ' (` [Shift + ´] becomes *)</li>
</ul>
In <b>detail</b>:
<ul>
	<li>AltGr + e builds €</li>
	<li>AltGr + c builds ©</li>
	<li>AltGr + ö builds ş (s with <b>cedilla</b> bellow), and AltGr + Ö builds Ş</li>
	<li>AltGr + ä builds ţ (t with <b>cedilla</b> bellow), and AltGr + Ä builds Ţ</li>
	<li>´ is now a dead key only in combination with AltGr + ´</li>
	<li>` is now a dead key only in combination with AltGr + Shift + ´</li>
	<li>¨ is now a dead key only in combination with AltGr + ¨</li>
	<li>^ is now a dead key only in combination with AltGr + Shift + ¨</li>
	<li>~ is now a dead key only in combination with AltGr + '</li>
</ul>
<b>Polish</b> Features:
<ul>
	<li>AltGr + p becomes a dead key, allowing for the Polish Programmers layout to kick in</li>
	<li>z, x, c, n, a, s, l, e, o, after AltGr + p, will become
ż, ź, ć, ń, ą, ś, ł, ę, ó</li>
</ul>
This driver will install a keyboard layout under the name
<b>Swedish - Romanian (Standard), Romanian (Legacy) [AltGr], Polish (Programmers) [deadkey]</b>
<blockquote><b>AltGr</b> because it allows <b>Legacy </b>diacritics with cedilla - ş and ţ - by pressing AltGr+ö and AltGr+ä
<b>deadkey</b> because you can have the <b>Polish (Programmers)</b> layout with the use of a dead key</blockquote>
<i>Swedish/Finnish Original Layout
</i><img src="http://blog.andreineculau.com/2008/01/snag-0001-080111-151818.png" style="border:0 none;" height="180" width="260" />

<i>My Layout</i>
<img src="http://blog.andreineculau.com/2008/01/snag-0002-080111-175038.png" style="border:0 none;" height="180" width="260" />

<i>My Layout in AltGr state</i>
<img src="http://blog.andreineculau.com/2008/01/snag-0003-080111-175057.png" style="border:0 none;" height="180" width="260" />]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Research Methodology and Scientific Writing</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/?p=784</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 30 Nov -0001 00:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.andreineculau.com/?p=784</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[My first semester at KTH was a bit troublesome - not hard, not easy, just confusing. It made me put that Popeye face..

<strong>Research Methodology and Scientific Writing</strong> was one of the small reasons for that. And I stress <strong>small</strong>. The big ones will follow.

<strong>Plot</strong>

This course, in its nature, cannot have a great impact on how you prepare, on how you get the assignments done. Nor on what grade you get. The course is meant to take the students through the basics of finding a research issue, formulating a problem, doing research on the topic and writing about your research findings. All of these can be common-sense for some and alien for others. So, in the end, this shows more of what you can do on your own than what you can achieve with what you have been "fed" during the course.

Altogether, there isn't that much that you can grasp from the outside, from the course. It is ~all about what you grasp from the inside - on your own, about the topic you choose, about the style you convey, etc, etc. It is very much a reflective and contemplating course.

<strong>Script</strong>

I guess that after reading the above, you can understand that there's little to do with the literature of the course. The literature - The Craft of Research (Booth, Colomb &amp; Williams) - is really useful, but it only lays down the basics. It creates the conditions for you to write a good research paper, but it doesn't push you towards that. What could maybe not push you towards that, but set your mind towards that would be the lectures. But.. :)

<strong>Cast</strong>

Having more than one lecturer was really good. The lecture given by <a href="http://people.dsv.su.se/~robban/">Robert Ramberg</a> was most appreciated if not by all, at least by me. He had a very structured and pin-pointing lecture on research methodology, covering both direct and indirect observations. Brilliant! Yet at the same time you can have lectures with <a href="http://people.dsv.su.se/~verhagen/">Harko Verhagen</a>. Cool lectures, but with many points that are hard to grasp or that are hard to pay attention to. Not to mention that his way of sharpening the mind and his way of replacing the snap-your-fingers-to-catch-the-attention measures were a bit.. un-orthodox lets say. Being sublime or wicked is not an excuse for showing how low some students' English or mind skills are. Maybe it's wrong to mention this, since I don't have the proof, but poking students that wouldn't even get your "sarcasm".. This falls for me under the category of "behind the back", mistrust and demeaning.
* I have another course with Harko right now (2nd semester), and it makes me want to change the above, but for the sake of being exact, I'll keep as it is

<strong>Management</strong>

Despite the self-enriching course, the course should have been much better organized. Especially since this course is being given each year to all masters students, accompanied by some PhD students as well. A couple of hundred international students attending this each year at the Kista campus. All of the course material and discussion were on <a href="http://www.firstclass.com">FirstClass</a> support. That means some sort of a forum software. Now image this:
<ul>
	<li>Lecture slides were uploaded now and then</li>
	<li>One "forum" handled course messages</li>
	<li>One "forum" handled course material</li>
	<li>One "forum" handled free discussions</li>
	<li>One "forum" handled hand ins</li>
	<li>One "forum" handled supervision (which I can't really get, since supervision should've been carried out with one supervisor any way, so why a "forum" ?)</li>
	<li>Two more "forums" - Groups and Student Council - which weren't used in the end (Wow! I wonder why, when we needed so many more! *sarcasm, Aron!*)</li>
</ul>
<strong>Development</strong>

Now let me show you the path for each assignment - Research Proposal, Research Paper and Opposition Report.

<em>Research Proposal</em> - now this was easy. We had about one good week to find a research topic, to formulate the problem and to give a hint on how we would like to pursue the research. No biggie there in terms of administration. We were given a layout, and we had to do a 2 minute presentation. We were assigned a supervisor and then got had a back-and-forth in order to settle down for a good proposal with the supervisor.

I went through this course and its assignments with Aron Henriksson. You can choose to go through the research on your own, or with a colleague. We were assigned <a href="http://people.dsv.su.se/~js/">Janis Stirna</a> as supervisor.]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>784</wp:post_id>

		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>

		<wp:post_name></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>draft</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>post</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
		<category domain="post_tag" nicename="kth"><![CDATA[kth]]></category>
		<category domain="post_tag" nicename="masters"><![CDATA[masters]]></category>
		<category domain="post_tag" nicename="period-12"><![CDATA[period 1.2]]></category>
		<category domain="category" nicename="uncategorized"><![CDATA[Uncategorized]]></category>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key>_edit_last</wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>

	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Must-know Swedish bits&amp;pieces</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/?p=801</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 30 Nov -0001 00:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.andreineculau.com/?p=801</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<strong>Miljöstation</strong>
Sweden tries to be very environmentally aware. You may have Miljöstation houses which will allow you to separate different types of waste in order to be recycled (glass, paper/newspaper, cardboard, plastic, etc.). But this is only for combustible waste, usually. When you have something else, you need to find a mijlöstation center. For each "city" (or better said: for each district) you have a miljöstation center that accepts also wood, metal, electronics, lamps, hazardous waste, and batteries, among others. You will need to find that place online. For instance, if you need to find one in Stockholm go to <a href="http://www.stockholm.se/avfall/miljostationer">http://www.stockholm.se/avfall/miljostationer</a> and select your district.

<strong>Post boxes</strong>
Unlike other countries where the Post Service separates mail as national and international, or as regular and express, here in Sweden (some exceptions apply due to post deregulations in parts of Sweden), they have separate boxes for local and non-local mailing. Local for Stockholm would mean all mailing done in Stockholmslän. Non-local is both national and international.

Bikes

Systembolaget

Tap water]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>801</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2009-02-13 12:55:49</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>0000-00-00 00:00:00</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>draft</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>

	<item>
		<title>The Theory of Relativity in University Life</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/2006/01/the-theory-of-relativity-in-university-life/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 31 Jan 2006 20:37:02 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2006/01/31/the-theory-of-relativity-in-university-life/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Have you ever thought that things change along with your perspective? Not as much as how you see things, but things that you do change the perspective itself. More like, change &ldquo;reality&rdquo;, whatever it may be.</p><p>I do.</p><p>My own example is that since the moment you put your pen down at an exam, and the moment when you are notified about the grade, things can change.</p><p>I somehow believe that when you finished the exam, not all variables have been defined, therefore not even your grade. Most students go out of the examination room, and think &ldquo;I blew it&rdquo; or &ldquo;I did great&rdquo;. Somewhat true nevertheless, but not entirely.</p><p>It wasn&rsquo;t only once when things haven&rsquo;t been like that. I do not have the proper knowledge to explain this fully, but still&hellip; In this matter, I believe without seeing. It&rsquo;s relativity that actually makes this happen.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>30</wp:post_id>

		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>

	<item>
		<title>The Theory of Relativity in relation to... Trinklets</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/2006/02/the-theory-of-relativity-in-relation-to-trinklets/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 01 Feb 2006 08:51:34 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2006/02/01/the-theory-of-relativity-in-relation-to-trinklets/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Yeah, yeah&hellip; I know that you may say&hellip; what the hell is a &ldquo;trinklet&rdquo;?
It&rsquo;s the key-ring that you hold your keys linked.</p><p>What&rsquo;s the connection with the theory of relativity?</p><p>Well, usually you give trinklets as a gift. It&rsquo;s one of those things that people use several times a day. It&rsquo;s a tricky gift&hellip; you give it in order for that someones to remind themselves of you.</p><p>Relativity comes when&hellip; you give it having so much faith that it will trigger memories, feelings, thoughts, questions, and the new owner has no such events.</p><p>It&rsquo;s a bit sad. Almost like being ignored.
Yet, the beauty of our lives it&rsquo;s simply in the action of giving that trinklet. It&rsquo;s the expectations that kill us or give a boost to our positive thinking. Yet, somehow&hellip; it&rsquo;s not too healthy.</p><p>Relative: how can something mean so much&nbsp;for someone, and so little for someone else? It&rsquo;s simply a trinklet, for heaven&rsquo;s sake.</p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Me and my HP nx9030  laptop</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/2006/01/me-and-my-hp-nx9030-laptop/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 25 Jan 2006 17:05:41 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2006/01/25/me-and-my-hp-nx9030-laptop/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[The laptop is almost brand new. Only one year old.

Yet… the nx9030 has a bad history with time-related features. Some people had almost no clock support, others had problems with time zone differences, etc.

I had problems with it not running the time correctly after shutdown/hibernate. If I shut it down at 10:30, when I powered it again… after more than 5 hours let’s say, the times was showing only 11:23 or something.

Therefore the main board was replaced. For free. That’s not all… I had problems with the hard drive – bad sectors. That one replace as well. For free God thanks!

Now….well, guess what. After having almost a month since the main board replacement, the video is playing tricks on me. The brightness keeps flickering. And I only have a couple of days left out of the warranty.

Only one question: why me?]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Laptop OUT OF ORDER</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/2006/01/laptop-out-of-order/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 26 Jan 2006 13:48:00 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2006/01/26/laptop-out-of-order/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Well, starting today, I'm counting the 3rd time my laptop is in service.</p>
<p>Unbelievable, but true. No AC power!</p>
<p>I'm starting to seriously doubt HP, or at least the nx9*** series. Had 4 service events in 3 months. That's surreal for a 1 year "new" laptop.</p>
<p>Seriously talking the guys wanted to tell me that warranty is out, but since I had it in service for almost 1 month, the warranty extends with 1 month.</p>
<p>I also don't know about their replacing policy, because I'm in the mood to change the entire laptop. I don't want a notebook in dispair, without warranty and repair it over and over again.</p>
<p>Would you?
</p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>IIS error - 0x8ffe2740</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/2006/02/iis-error-0x8ffe2740/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 01 Feb 2006 14:15:16 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2006/02/01/iis-error-0x8ffe2740/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[If you want to start the Web Server, and the software throws a message like “Unexpected error 0x8ffe2740” then the answer is: another software application has binded localhost’s port 80, or any port number that you selected for your Web Server.

The most common application that does that is Skype, which has an option to use port 80 or 443 as alternatives to the specified port. Check settings.]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>41</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2006-02-01 16:15:16</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2006-02-01 14:15:16</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>iis-error-0x8ffe2740</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>publish</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>

			<wp:comment_content><![CDATA[şi totuşi... oare dacă o formaţie are "hit-uri după hit-uri" e...marfă?!

oricum ar fi, nu-mi aduc aminte să fi fost vreo formaţie în ultima vreme care să fie "legendară"... nu văd nici Black Eyed Peas peste câţiva ani să fie Wow... să ne creştem noi copilaşii dragi, şi să îi auzim vreodată cu Black Eyed Peas...

poate sunt eu de modă veche...dar un Queen, ABBA, Bob Marley, Louis Armstrong, etc. şi până şi Michael Jackson... nu mai vezi. nu doar pentru că sunt unici în felul lor, ci pentru că rareori mai vezi lume care să facă muzică cu sufletul... iar cei care fac, probabil o simt atât de preţioasă încât o ţin doar pentru ei...

eu la Urma... nu văd altceva decât muzică care zice ceva... nu doar ritm, nu doar versuri, nu doar fete bune pe ecran, nu doar rime care să le memorezi cât ai clipi şi după aia să te vezi mergând pe stradă fredonând "ciocolata e a mea, nu o daula nimenea.." ........

Urma e momentan pentru mine mica rază de speranţă că se-ntâmplă şi lucruri bune... nu doar "plagiaturi", "same song, different lyrics" sau "hmm...îmi pare rău..eu creez muzică. voi sunteţi de vină că nu-mi înţelegeţi muzica.." . Hai dă-te drequ-n Doamne iartă-mă, că nu te-o fi făcut mumăta geniu acuma. Şi chiar de-ar fi, geniile parcă tre să-i lumineze pe alţi, nu să le-o frece-n nas!

I rest my case!]]></wp:comment_content>

			<wp:comment_content><![CDATA[Nimic mai adevarat ceea ce spui. Si pe langa cei mentionati de tine as mai adauga UB40, Madona, Fugees, plus altii care nu imi vin in minte acuma, dar pe care ii ascult dintotdeauna cu placere.

In principiu imi place orice gen de muzica. Ce ascult depinde foarte mult de starea in care ma aflu. Daca sunt suparat ascult cu cea mai mare placere Parazitii. Daca sunt melancolic ascult blues-uri (sper ca am scris bine), si asa mai departe.
Daca e sa luam ceea ce se exprima prin versuri, asculta niste muzica de la Parazitii... incercand sa faci abstractie de injuraturi.
Oricum nu despre ce imi place mie e vorba.
Ideile principale sunt :
a) MUZICA = "Arta de a exprima sentimente şi idei cu ajutorul sunetelor combinate într-o manieră specifică" (conform dex)
b) gusturile nu se discuta
Asa ca pot sa ii povestesc eu cat vreau de HipHop unui rocker ca nu o sa inteleaga nimic, si vice versa.

Concluzie: la unii le place Urma la altii nu :P:P:P:P:P
C'est la vie !!!]]></wp:comment_content>

	<item>
		<title>Windows XP missing icons in notification area</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/2006/03/windows-xp-missing-icons-in-notification-area/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 07 Mar 2006 19:07:55 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2006/03/07/windows-xp-missing-icons-in-notification-area/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[I’ve decided to format my main partition… reason:sluggish system.

Afterwards, I noticed that the notification area didn’t hold the icons anymore. Not even with the option of  “Hide inactive icons” turned off.

Solution: Open “Network Places” and on the left you should have an option saying “Hide icons for networked UPnP devices”. Click it and restart.

You’d like to understand this action, right?… Huh… just a Windows bug!]]></content:encoded>

			<wp:comment_content><![CDATA[Draga Andrei,

Merci pentru ajutor. Ai avut o idee buna sa afisezi solutia asta la problema aceea. Este intr-adevar destul de enervant sa nu vezi nimic in zona de notificare. Nesperat de simpla rezolvarea.

Daca nu te deranjeaza as dori sa-ti mai pun o intrebare referitor la o problemuta in XP :
Dupa startarea pc, daca apas pe una din tastele Ctrl, Shift sau Alt  se aude un bip. Daca mai apas o data se aude un bip pe un alt ton etc. Asta dureaza cam vreo zece apasari apoi nu se mai aude nimic.

Ai idee de unde ar putea fi ?
Comentariu : A fost instalata o tastatura si serviciu de limba romana dar le-am sters din "Text services and Input languages" in Control Panel &gt; Regional settings. Totusi bipurile persista.


Iti doresc Succes in proiectele tale.

Salutari,
Virgil Mandrea]]></wp:comment_content>

	<item>
		<title>Making Firefox faster</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/2006/03/making-firefox-faster/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 07 Mar 2006 19:12:00 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2006/03/07/making-firefox-faster/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Did you notice how Firefox doesn&rsquo;t load pages from the local cache upon hitting the Back button? This is what IE and Opera do, but not Firefox.</p>
<p>In order to speed things up, you need to trick Firefox into doing that. No obvious option exists.</p>
<p>Go to &ldquo;about:config&rdquo;. Right click inside the window and select New Integer. Enter &ldquo;browser.sessionhistory.max_viewers&rdquo; with a value of 5.</p>
<p>Test it. If you don&rsquo;t like it, or you have problems having this feature on, then just delete the new option from the list.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>65</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2006-03-07 21:12:00</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2006-03-07 19:12:00</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>making-firefox-faster</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>publish</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>post</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>

	<item>
		<title>Firefox for Broadband</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/2006/03/firefox-for-broadband/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 09 Mar 2006 06:35:27 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2006/03/09/firefox-for-broadband/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Type “about:config”

Set "network.http.pipelining" to "true"

Set "network.http.proxy.pipelining" to "true"

Set "network.http.pipelining.maxrequests" to some number like 30.

Right-click anywhere and select New-&gt; Integer. Name it "nglayout.initialpaint.delay" and set its value to "0"]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Firefox Keyword Searching</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/2006/03/firefox-keyword-searching/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 09 Mar 2006 07:28:27 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2006/03/09/firefox-keyword-searching/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[In Internet Explorer, or Opera you can easily use several search engines just by using a keyword in the address bar.

For example, typing “g windows xp” will search on Google, while “imdb crash” could search on IMDB.

How to do it in Firefox, though? Simply perform a search on your search engine, then bookmark that search into Quick Searches category. Go into Bookmark Manager, edit the properties of the bookmark, replace your search pattern with %s, and then choose a keyword to use in the future.

E.g.
1. go to imdb.com
2. perform a search for “crash”
3. bookmark
4. edit properties – change crash into %s, add a keyword
5. done!]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>The DaVinci Code</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/2006/03/the-davinci-code/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 14 Mar 2006 09:52:41 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2006/03/14/the-davinci-code/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Letter to <a href="http://www.jesusdecoded.com/" target="_blank">JesusDecoded.com</a></p>
<blockquote>
<p>Dear Sirs,<br />I just wanted to drop a line about your action to publish such a website.</p>
<p>While on one hand, I was glad to find that such initiatives exists, on the other hand I was not even dissapointed about the result, because in order to be dissapointed about something, that something must exist for real. </p></blockquote>

<!--more-->


<p></p>
<blockquote>
<p>Pros:<br />1. my hope that the church, may it be catholic or orthodox or other branches, has decided not to stand still and let people take every word in The DaVinci Code novel for real, without having any doubts</p>
<p>2. my hope that the church will help us, people, learn that not everything that shines is gold</p>
<p>3. my hope that the church learned through the years that MAKING people believe is worse than not believing at all, and that the best way to let people come towards God is LETTING them believe</p>
<p>Cons:<br />1. there are almost no real counter-arguments</p>
<p>2. the language that is used has the effect to distract the mind, thus making people uninterested</p>
<p>3. using sections like "WHAT DO YOU SAY TO A DA VINCI CODE BELIEVER?" is almost like brain-washing. Giving someone 1 million arguments in order to remember at least 10, or giving only a strong one, is far better than teaching WHAT TO SAY! Don't we strive for democracy and the right of free-speech? Free-speech also implies, for me, free-thinking! And that has nothing to do with "WHAT TO SAY WHEN/TO..."</p>
<p>4. the church seems to be still in its early years, when it banned everything and everyone out of the dogma, like it deed with Jesus Christ, because He said to be God's son. Maybe He was, maybe He wasn't. That's for each and every one of us to believe or disagree with.</p>
<p>5. the church falls in the trap of the tiniest details, and fails to sustain a good, solid debate. A non-debate would have been the very most gratious move. We should not waste any more time on sustaining that Jesus really existed, that He was merely a good man or that He was indeed God's son, that He was in love with Mary Magdalene, and many more controverses. While some people need a character or a place to associate with faith, good will, principles, love of all people, some may not. But all of them will run away from being forced/lead into this association. Not to mention that by this association (Jesus and God's will) you have people saying that Jesus is gone, so why care about today's life? It's totally different! Jesus and His life is one thing. Believing in God is another. Doing good deeds and having a joyful and fullfilling life through Light is yet another. The later should be the only goal! The only one! How many wars have been faught due to religious differences? Many! And tell me how many due to differences in opinion about "doing good"? None!</p>
<p>I honestly hope that some action will be taken.<br />Otherwise, you are not doing anything else than driving people away from believing, and leaving space to lack of belief in people's minds.</p>
<p>Where did "turn the other cheeck" go? Through actions such as this (publishing this website) you are merely starting your own fight/debate or whatever you want to call it, instead of simply stating That God exists in our mind and soul, and not in historical fiction, may it proove real or not.</p>
<p>A believer,<br />Andrei</p></blockquote>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Windows Firewall/Internet Connection Sharing  - Missing Service</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/2006/03/windows-firewallinternet-connection-sharing-missing-service/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 27 Mar 2006 18:45:05 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2006/03/27/windows-firewallinternet-connection-sharing-missing-service/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[I don’t know how I managed – must have been a Microsoft Update or some virus?! – but the “Windows Firewall/Internet Connection Sharing” Service was missing on my Windows XP.

Solution?
A very good one on <a href="http://www.experts-exchange.com/" target="_blank">Experts-Exchange</a>.

Go to a computer that is working ok. Start “regedit”. Go to HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services and export the branch SharedAccess. Then copy it to the system which lacks the service, and double-click it. That does it. <a href="http://www.experts-exchange.com/Operating_Systems/Q_21248930.html" target="_blank">More info</a>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Sport cu suflet</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/2006/03/suflet-cu-sport/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 27 Mar 2006 19:29:45 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2006/03/27/suflet-cu-sport/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Gazeta Sporturilor – Cătălin Tolontan

<a href="http://gsp.ro/index.php?arhiva=1&amp;a=38323&amp;p=2" target="_blank">http://gsp.ro/index.php?arhiva=1&amp;a=38323&amp;p=2</a>

Actualizare pe 20060529: Articolul complet!
<blockquote><strong>Ne vom lua Jocul înapoi</strong>

Articolul "De ce doar galeria lui Dinamo?", postat pe gsp.ro în timpul meciului Farul - Dinamo, a stîrnit sute de reacţii de la fani. Constănţenii l-au considerat o indulgenţă în favoarea dinamoviştilor, iar "cîinii", dimpotrivă, un atac la adresa lor.

Aproape toate mesajele decente au primit un răspuns. Chiar dacă avem opinii diferite, este esenţial să le susţinem civilizat.

Celor triviale, ameninţătoare şi violente le replicăm azi: nu dăm nici un pas înapoi! După Jenel şi Romel, voi sînteţi cei care aţi confiscat fotbalul! Da, voi! VOI, cu scaunele aruncate spre jandarmi, cu petardele care incendiază tribunele, cu înjurăturile de mamă, de fraţi, surori, morminte şi strămoşi, voi, cei care vă imaginaţi o mie de falusuri în gura antrenorului advers.

Ne-am săturat de voi! Sînteţi o minoritate violentă care vrea să se impună împotriva majorităţii şi împotriva Jocului! Probabil că cei mai răi şi mai animalici dintre voi nu depăşiţi cîteva zeci în fiecare galerie. Ne bombardaţi cu mailuri repetate şi urlaţi ca să păreţi mai mulţi. Nu sînteţi!

Mai devreme sau mai tîrziu, ne vom lua fotbalul înapoi. Veţi vedea meciurile, cum se întîmplă în toată Europa, din secţiile de poliţie. Iar pe stadion se vor întoarce oamenii care nu mai vin acum de greaţă, femeile care îşi amintesc în somn de bucuria sportului şi copiii pe care n-am apucat să-i ducem în tribune, răpindu-le o dimensiune esenţială a competiţiei umane!

27 martie 2006</blockquote>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>31st of March</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/2006/04/31st-of-march/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 03 Apr 2006 08:08:19 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2006/04/03/31st-of-march/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[One of the most “wild” days, yet one of the most rewarding ever.

How come?
Simply because 24 people in need, living in Bucharest, got to have a warm meal.

How come?
Simply because Ruxi and me managed to get them to destination, from my university’s cafeteria.

How come?
Simply because there were lots of money that would have been given away to the cafeteria staff, if they weren’t to be spent until the end of the month.

How come?
Simply because Cip (one of my room mates) let me spend it for him :)

Thanks to everyone involved, and may their thanks be heard up there.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Global Education Week</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/2006/04/global-education-week/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 07 Apr 2006 16:19:16 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2006/04/07/global-education-week/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[The second day is at its finish. It takes place in Sinaia, Romania.

All I can say is that adults are going for easy, silly things, because they think that children are stupid. Yet they go for complex, unclear, fuzzy and confusing words when it comes to higher levels of organisations, may them be governmental or not.

What is GEW all about? What is the North-South Centre (the organizer of this event)?

GEW means that once a year, schools get their students involved in projects that have to do with global aspects. Global in different meanings. The North-South Centre is a component of the Council of Europe. It deals with getting the Northern countries more involved in the aspects of the Southern countries. North to what? South to what?… Using this lack of clarity, they act in a wide range, focusing on partnerships for development.

More info at <a href="http://www.coe.int/T/E/North-South_Centre/">http://www.coe.int/T/E/North-South_Centre/</a> .]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>95</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2006-04-07 18:19:16</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2006-04-07 16:19:16</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>global-education-week</wp:post_name>

	<item>
		<title>Global Education Week - Sum up</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/2006/04/global-education-week-sum-up/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 14 Apr 2006 21:48:43 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2006/04/14/global-education-week-sum-up/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Sum up - Personal view

First of all I'd like to thank everyone for his/her input to this seminar. I've heard a lot of personal perspectives on Global Education, and on what North &amp; South means.

Starting with Franz and Milan which had more of an international view, focusing on relations with Africa, and Alicia with a drop of Latin-American mentality and soul, and ending with the Romanian view that saw things like students exchanging information with local companies/groups, and also with the French view, concerning the interaction between the natives and the immigrants.

Yet there's one more view, a personal view, a youth view. North being you, teachers, educators, trainers. And me and Magdalena and maybe also Cecilia, being the South, the youth, the students, and with a personal touch - still the children.

<!--more-->

I have to say that I've been prepared to hear big words around here. Big words, not strong words. Why? Because adults in general are often loosing focus of the simple things, which more often are the important things.

What I have not been prepared for was to be lost in these big words.

This is also the reason, why I'm doing this in written, and I have not been able to stand up and speak. Because during the meetings it was hard to keep focused. I often felt as if I was with a bunch of students at a very theoretical course, where you have the "educator" asking a question, yet the "students" having a very fuzzy idea on what they should answer with. That's why the workshops often started with clearing out the topic, and then trying to reach the topic. Therefore, I feel I'm right when I say that there were big words, big concepts flying by.

I started to say that my view is more like youth versus adults, students versus teachers/educators. To be more honest, it is more vice-versa. Adults versus youth, educators versus students.

Why?
Simply because there was little interest to hear the voice of the youth during this seminar. People tended to take the network out of context. There was a lot of talk about "THE network", as an isolated group, a group that acts upon another one - how to attract new organizations, how to improve contacts. At a much dimmed level, this creates nevertheless a hierarchy - already talked about it during one of the workshops, by mentioning some problems with ownership and all that follows from that.

Without realizing it, there has been a Northern group (adults) created right here, in a group that deals with North-South relations (focuses on together). Quite a paradox.

I don't know if I'm speaking righteous in the name of the youth, yet the EXCHANGE is the central word!

What we are doing here is an exchange. We are the main ones that win something real, almost touchable, that we can feel in our own hands.

The exchange is taking a lot of forms. The form with the most important impact is still the international exchange, concerned about the social level. It is this type of exchange, where you, from Argentina, go to France and learn about the people and culture, that helps breaking stereotypes and barriers of any types - cultural, economical, religion-based, etc.
Without any doubt, other types of exchanges are the least to say useful.
I'm proud to say that the Romanian example is a very good one - putting together students, future employees, with their future employers, local companies. Without a doubt, when you give a chance to see youth at work, you definitely reach the idea that you have a LOT to learn from the new generations!

I think that without knowing, you already acknowledge this when you don't know how to work with your computer, yet when you ask for help from a 10 year old, before you know it, he has solved the issue, and you can move on with your work.

I don't want you to believe that I'm lobbying for Life-Link, or anything. I'm lobbying for myself, for my own generation. It is a "coincidence", if you will, that Life-Link has this vision focused on the youth, and its branches - teachers, parents, community. I was talking to Kevin yesterday, and I was telling him that when you involve youth into different projects - they manage to involve the ones near them as well. For example when a project needs money or time, because of the parents' need to control, they want to inform themselves, and they start to ask questions. "Why do you need 5 euros? Why are you spending so much time at school, after the regular courses? Why do you believe in this &lt;&lt; silly project&gt;&gt;?" Youth, without any doubt can be the best advocacy activists, the best lawyers… with a condition: they need the chance to be heard.

More or less this is what happens at Alicia's place, where they have the students gathering up and "fighting" for what they believe, while the educators are putting their ears into value.
More or less what happens in Lithuania, if I remember correctly, where there's also a national student committee that delivers the students' issues to the Ministry of Education. I hope I'm not mistaken when I say that in Romania this doesn't happen. There are only student councils at schools, … maybe! Even when they do exist, they are superficial. Why? Because they lack the self-esteem, the citizenship, the feeling that they have power, and that they are part of their community, and also that they can change something.

I also want to remind you that it is easier to start from scratch (with the youth), then to change (the nowadays adults).

I'm not saying that working with adults is a wrong thing. Not at all!
Yet, in this network the teachers take the lead, while students/youth are the target. In democracy you usually ask the target as well. Alicia pointed out very well today that in the perspective of having the North as the developed countries of the Northern hemisphere, and South as Africa &amp; South-America… we seem not to ask the Southern partners how they see their relation with the North and what they think we can do together.

Through the years, when people wanted to help or to change something, they often started from the perspective of what they can do for others, and not how they can join forces.
The process of give and take was taken down to we give, we take, and the idea that is often heard in peace seminars of having win-win situations was lost. Win-win is when you give and somebody else gives something in return!

Madeleine said something in the very beginning of our meetings. "I like practice and not so much the theory". I immediately felt that I relate to that.

I sincerely don't want to look on the dark side of this. It's like Kevin said taking upon Madeleine's creative story: every bit of water is our small step, our small contribution. Yet, I feel that many meetings end up with the "Youth is the hope…The next generation".

Firstly, if you think that youth is so important, where's the youth within the decision process?
Secondly, by going on with the theme of "next generation" I don't see such a bright future soon. There's a joke in Romanian coming from a saying that goes like "Don't leave your today's duties for tomorrow", and the joke, often spread around the students is "Don't leave your today's duties for tomorrow, leave them for the day after tomorrow, and maybe they will be done by themselves".

A very great step towards bringing communities together is the IT without any doubt. Now you talk to someone 2 meters away from you, tomorrow you still speak to that someone, yet that someone is on another continent.
Yes you can even meet your wife, or your husband through the Internet, yet what Vic forgot to say is that almost 75% of those marriages end up within the next 6 months, and the others end up on the way.

During these days I felt like watching a movie called "The girl in the café", a story based on a civil servant that take this girl to the G8 summit, and this girl is the only one that is facing the reality as everybody should. She's the only one that treats the issue of 3rd world's poverty with courage, while the G8 groups focus on how not to take away much money from their countries, in order not to make their citizens angry. At the heart of this movie are the nameless, faceless millions who suffer daily and the ease with which this fact is taken as statistic. Africa has never before been on the forefront of social issues as it is today and to anyone who might be under the impression that poverty is an issue for politicians to sort out around the conference table, 'The Girl in the Cafe' is a potent reminder that the power to affect change is more immediate than we might think.

But for this there is a need for bold steps. I'm waiting for the youth to make these bold steps. Why? Because the adults of today, although they have nothing to lose, other than the better future of their sons and daughters, they are afraid to act with courage.

That's my constructive criticism. Hopefully it's not just criticism.
Andrei]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Giving...</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/2006/04/giving/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 14 Apr 2006 21:51:28 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2006/04/14/giving/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>On the <a href="http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2006/04/03/31st-of-march/">31st of March</a>, the word &ldquo;to give&rdquo; started to have another meaning.</p>
<p>Today, 15th of April, I experience again this meaning.</p>
<p>We&rsquo;re giving some food to some people in need.</p>
<p>Thanks to You above for giving this chance. I guess nothing can be compared to the feeling you get when you hear a very truthful Thank you&hellip; Nothing.</p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>...and not receiving</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/2006/04/and-not-receiving/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 16 Apr 2006 10:32:23 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2006/04/16/and-not-receiving/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>You know, something amazed me during this&hellip; give away food to people in need.</p>
<p>It is a habit to reframe from eating meat or any othe animal-origin food before feasts. It is a religious thing.</p>
<p>Yet, I was stupefied to see an old lady not accepting the food we were giving her, just because there was some meat.</p>
<p>I think somebody that I met during the Global Education Seminar in Sinaia, Kevin from &ldquo;the Irish pubs&rsquo; country&rdquo;, put this type of situation in the right spot. &ldquo;I don&rsquo;t eat meat, or I try not to, but if it is given to me, I accept it as being a gift. It&rsquo;s my pleasure to accept when it is given. It would be worse to say no.&rdquo;</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>99</wp:post_id>

	<item>
		<title>Faith &amp; God</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/2006/04/faith-god/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 17 Apr 2006 09:03:40 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2006/04/17/faith-god/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>AN INTERESTING CONVERSATION .</p>
<p>An atheist professor of philosophy speaks to his class on the problem science has with God, The Almighty.</p>
<p>He asks one of his new students to stand and&hellip;</p>
<blockquote>
<p>Prof: So you believe in God?<br />Student: Absolutely, sir.</p>
<p>Prof: Is God good?<br />Student: Sure.</p>
<p>Prof: Is God all-powerful?<br />Student: Yes.</p>
<p>Prof: My brother died of cancer even though he prayed to God to heal him.</p>
<p>Most of us would attempt to help others who are ill.<br />But God didn't.<br />How is this God good then? Hmm?</p></blockquote>

<!--more-->


<p>(Student is silent.)</p>
<blockquote>
<p>Prof: You can't answer, can you? Let's start again, young fellow. Is God&nbsp; good?<br />Student: Yes.</p>
<p>Prof: Is Satan good?<br />Student: No.</p>
<p>Prof: Where does Satan come from?<br />Student: From...God...</p>
<p>Prof: That's right. Tell me son, is there evil in this world?<br />Student: Yes.</p>
<p>Prof: Evil is everywhere, isn't it? And God did make everything. Correct?<br />Student: Yes.</p>
<p>Prof: So who created evil?<br />Student does not answer.</p>
<p>Prof: Is there sickness? Immorality? Hatred? Ugliness? All these terrible things exist in the world, don't they?<br />Student: Yes, sir.</p>
<p>Prof: So, who created them?<br />Student has no answer.</p>
<p>Prof: Science says you have 5 senses you use to identify and observe the world around you. Tell me, son...Have you ever seen God?<br />Student: No, sir.</p>
<p>Prof: Tell us if you have ever heard your God?<br />Student: No, sir.</p>
<p>Prof: Have you ever felt your God, tasted your God, smelt your God? Have you ever had any sensory perception of God for that matter?<br />Student: No, sir. I'm afraid I haven't.</p>
<p>Prof: Yet you still believe in Him?<br />Student: Yes.</p>
<p>Prof: According to empirical, testable, demonstrable protocol, science says your GOD doesn't exist. What do you say to that, son?<br />Student: Nothing. I only have my faith.</p>
<p>Prof: Yes. Faith. And that is the problem science has.</p>
<p>Student: Professor, is there such a thing as heat?<br />Prof: Yes.</p>
<p>Student: And is there such a thing as cold?<br />Prof: Yes.</p>
<p>Student: No sir. There isn't.</p>
<p>(The lecture theatre becomes very quiet with this turn<br />of events.)</p>
<p>Student: Sir, you can have lots of heat, even more heat, superheat, mega heat, white heat, a little heat or no heat. But we don't have anything called cold. We can hit 458 degrees below<br />zero which is no heat, but we can't go any further after that. There is no such thing as cold.<br />Cold is only a word we use to describe the absence of heat.</p>
<p>We cannot measure cold. Heat is energy. Cold is not the opposite of heat, sir, just the absence of it.</p>
<p>(There is pin-drop silence in the lecture theatre.)</p>
<p>Student: What about darkness, Professor? Is there such a thing as darkness?<br />Prof: Yes. What is night if there isn't darkness?</p>
<p>Student: You're wrong again, sir. Darkness is the absence of something. You can have low light, normal light, bright light, flashing light....But if you have no light constantly, you have<br />nothing and it's called darkness,&nbsp; isn't it? In reality, darkness isn't. If it were you would be able to make darkness darker, wouldn't you?<br />Prof: So what is the point you are making, young man?</p>
<p>Student: Sir, my point is your philosophical premise is flawed.<br />Prof: Flawed? Can you explain how?</p>
<p>Student: Sir, you are working on the premise of duality. You argue there is life and then there is death, a good God and a bad God. You are viewing the concept of God as something&nbsp; finite, something we can measure. Sir, science can't even explain a thought. It uses<br />electricity and magnetism, but has never seen, much less fully understood either one.</p>
<p>To view death as the opposite of life is to be ignorant of the fact that death cannot exist as a substantive thing. Death is not the opposite of&nbsp; life: just the absence of it. Now tell<br />me, Professor. Do you teach your students that they evolved from a monkey?</p>
<p>Prof: If you are referring to the natural evolutionary process, yes, of course, I do.</p>
<p>Student: Have you ever observed evolution with your own eyes, sir?</p>
<p>(The Professor shakes his head with a smile, beginning to realize where the argument is going.)</p>
<p>Student: Since no one has ever observed the process of evolution at work and cannot even prove that this process is an on-going endeavor, are you not teaching your opinion, sir? Are<br />you not a scientist but a preacher? (The class is in uproar.)</p>
<p>Student: Is there anyone in the class who has ever seen the Professor's brain?<br />(The class breaks out into laughter.)</p>
<p>Student: Is there anyone here who has ever heard the Professor's brain, felt it, touched or smelt it? No one appears to have done so. So, according to the established rules of empirical, stable, demonstrable protocol, science says that you have no brain, sir. With all due respect, sir, how do we then trust your lectures, sir?</p>
<p>(The room is silent. The professor stares at the student, his face&nbsp;unfathomable.)</p>
<p>Prof: I guess you'll have to take them on faith, son.</p>
<p>Student: That is it sir... The link between man &amp; god is FAITH. That is all that keeps things moving &amp; alive.</p></blockquote>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Nero InCD</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/2006/04/nero-incd/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 20 Apr 2006 17:33:11 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2006/04/20/nero-incd/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[If you know what packet writing is, or you have noticed that since some time now, you can use your CDs/DVDs (especially the rewritable ones) as an extension to your hard drive, simply writing and deleting from the drive, then you might also have encountered some issues with Nero’s InCD.

Upon start up, it throws an error saying that its API could not be loaded.

My only fix to this, was to remove it from the start up registry keys – you can also use “msconfig” to disable it from running at the start up, and simply run it after the system is fully loaded.

It is even better this way if you think about it. You are only loading it, when you want to, and not just every start up. Great for laptops.]]></content:encoded>

		<title>Styled Horizontal Lines - HR</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/2006/04/styled-horizontal-lines-hr/</link>

A problem arises when you want to style it, in a cross-browser way.

	<item>
		<title>Height and widths - maximum and minimum</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/2006/04/height-and-widths-maximum-and-minimum/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 23 Apr 2006 09:59:51 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2006/04/23/height-and-widths-maximum-and-minimum/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[IE defines the “height” CSS property with a touch of flexibility. It means that the block should have at least the defined height.

In order to set a maximum height you need to set its “max-height” CSS property.

In Firefox, “height” means height! Meaning that your content will go outside the block, if it does not fit.

In order to set a minimum height you need to set its “min-height” CSS property and mask the “height”, in order to let only IE see it (use “_height”).]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Preloading JavaScript</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/2006/05/preloading-javascript/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 19 May 2006 08:28:18 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2006/05/19/preloading-javascript/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[If you are starting to wonder with Prototype and Ajax, etc. then you might have noticed that the JavaScript libraries are getting too big.

If you haven’t, then I’m telling you that Prototype and two other Effects libraries can take up to 300kb. Imagine the visitor sitting with a page for more than 1 minute in front of his eyes, that is simply blank.

If you’re thinking that preloading is easy, it is not. Maybe I’m not using a proper term for this, but what I mean by preloading is that while the browser is loading the JavaScript libraries in his cache (hopefully it has a cache, otherwise it will load them over and over again for each page) the visitor doesn’t get any input.

Don’t get carried away saying that you just update a DIV or something, and tell the visitor what is happening in the background. Since these JS files need to be in the HEAD, you can’t really control the loading of the BODY, plus depending on the browser JS files are loaded (a)sync.

The solution I’m proposing is to use a W3CDOM solution, which means that you in the BODY you have a script that creates DOM elements with tag SCRIPT, then add them to the HEAD element. You can also attach an onload/onreadystatechange (non-IE / IE) event to see when one library has loaded, and move on to the next one.

This way you are downloading the JS libraries (sync.) and can put a progress bar for the visitor. You should put this on an intro page, and then send the visitor to the main page, having all JS libraries already in his/her browser’s cache.

Don’t worry about not all browsers accepting W3CDOM. If they don’t, then they should have nothing to do with Prototype and advanced scripting.

One last thing: if you think about visitors accesing your website through another page, other than your intro page, then simply check the REFERRER and if the domain is different from yours, then send him/her to the intro page automatically.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Future of web browsers</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/2006/05/future-of-web-browsers/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 19 May 2006 10:11:19 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2006/05/19/future-of-web-browsers/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[I don’t know if I’m simply day-dreaming, but I guess that future browsers will offer full support for updatable JS libraries.

Thus, no more SCRIPT tag for loading Prototype and other AJAX / Effects libraries.

Why? Because web concepts are exploding quite fast nowadays, and simply having support for ECMA script is not enough. Plus these libraries are getting to be widely used, thus a question comes up: why should we download 200kb off every website we visit, which are the same 200kb every time? 200kb is not that much when you’re using at least a Cable connection, but what about DialUp ?

I may not have time to go into building an extension for Firefox, but one that searches through SCRIPT tags and replaces those connecting to Prototype, Rico, etc with locally hosted files… that would be nice, right?

Now playing: <strong>Sade - Smooth operator</strong>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>PHP and register_globals ON!!!</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/2006/05/php-and-register_globals-on/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 19 May 2006 16:36:01 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2006/05/19/php-and-register_globals-on/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<strong>Context</strong>: register_globals is a configuration flag for PHP, inside php.ini that that instructs PHP to take all the variables sent to the script through GET, POST, etc. to be registered as PHP variables

<strong>Example</strong>: you access info.php?day=5. Inside this script, with register_globals turned On, you can test like this: if ($day == 5) {…}. If you have it Off, then you should do this: if ($_GET[’day’] == 5) {…}

<strong>Advice</strong>: turn if Off. It is the default for PHP 5 and higher! Why? It is a security whole letting visitors inject variables into your code, and in turn, while it first makes your job easier, you get less secure code! Therefore, if you are a good programmer, you will spend more time testing and improving security.

If you use a webhost that has this setting turned On, then ask them to help you turn it Off for your website, or even better convince them to turn it Off for every client. THIS SETTING IS OBSOLETE STARTING WITH PHP 5, and will NOT EXIST IN PHP 6 AT ALL!!!

If the webhost is running PHP as an Apache module, then you can simply create a .htaccess file and fill it with “php_flag register_globals 0”. On Apache 2 this will not work, but give an Internal Server Error. It has to be put by your host in the VirtualHost handler for your website.

If you really want to stick with that specific webhost, and there’s no solution to turn it Off (i.e. they are running PHP as CGI) use the code bellow.

<strong>Explanation</strong>: it will first take all global variables, and unset everything that shouldn’t be there. Do not worry about your code still being accesible for changes (i.e. info.php?_ENV[OS]=NewOS ). The PHP queue works like this: first it registers variables from GET, etc. and then it fills in the global variables _GET, _POST, etc. (I wonder why the hack they are not READ ONLY!) Therefore you will have the correct associative arrays, without any injected modification.

[sourcecode language="php"]if (ini_get('register_globals')){
foreach($GLOBALS as $s_variable_name => $m_variable_value){
if (!in_array($s_variable_name, array('GLOBALS', 'argv',
'argc', '_FILES', '_COOKIE', '_POST', '_GET', '_SERVER',
'_ENV', '_SESSION', '_REQUEST',
's_variable_name', 'm_variable_value')
)){
unset($GLOBALS[$s_variable_name]);
}
}
unset($GLOBALS['s_variable_name']);
unset($GLOBALS['m_variable_value']);
}
[/sourcecode]

<strong>Links</strong>:
<a href="http://ro2.php.net/manual/en/security.globals.php">http://ro2.php.net/manual/en/security.globals.php</a>
<a href="http://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/Programming:PHP:Register_Globals">http://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/Programming:PHP:Register_Globals</a>
<a href="http://www.sitepoint.com/print/php-security-blunders">http://www.sitepoint.com/print/php-security-blunders</a>
<a href="http://www.simiandesign.com/blog-fu/2004/08/php_register_gl.php">http://www.simiandesign.com/blog-fu/2004/08/php_register_gl.php</a>
<a href="http://www.securephpwiki.com/index.php/Global_Variables">http://www.securephpwiki.com/index.php/Global_Variables</a>
<a href="http://www.filipdewaard.com/php/real-life-php-security-breach/">http://www.filipdewaard.com/php/real-life-php-security-breach/</a>

* the above code is not mine. I found it on the Internet, while I was looking for a solution.

[LATER EDIT]
Switched to WordPress's sourcecode tag]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Switching from PHP 4 to PHP 5</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/2006/05/switching-from-php-4-to-php-5/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 19 May 2006 16:38:49 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2006/05/19/switching-from-php-4-to-php-5/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[If you use super globals, then you might have noticed that they changed the names for the super globals (i.e. $HTTP_GET_VARS turned into $_GET, etc)

For small scripts or future scripts, you should simply replace/use the new names.

But what do you do when you have big applications, or you use someone else’s applications?

The solution lies in references. Simply put at the beginning of your PHP code:
[sourcecode language="php"]
$HTTP_GET_VARS &= $_GET;
$HTTP_POST_VARS &= $_POST;
...
[/sourcecode]

[LATER EDIT]
Thanks to Rique for pointing out the erroneous variable switch.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>RegEx for URI (non IP) (website) matching</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/2006/05/regex-for-uri-non-ip-website-address-matching/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 21 May 2006 12:35:18 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2006/05/21/regex-for-uri-non-ip-website-address-matching/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[I’ve been trying to find a relatively good regular expression, but there wasn’t one that did the trick for me.

My 2 hours work led me here (join lines before use):
<pre width="50">(?:(?:http(s)?://)|(www\.))
((?:(?:(?:\w|\-|\_)+\.)+)(?:[a-z]{2,5}))
((?:/(?:(?:(?:(?:\w|\-|\_)+\.)*
(?:\w|\-|\_)+/?)*))*)
(\?(?:\S*))?</pre>
<hr />Let’s take it step by step:

<code>(?:(?:http(s)?://)|(www\.))</code>
$1 – gives HTTP’s security
$2 – gives “www.” or null

<code>(((?:(?:(?:\w|\-|\_)+\.)+)(?:[a-z]{2,5}))</code>
$3 – gives the domain name, sometimes without “www.”

<code>((?:/(?:(?:(?:(?:\w|\-|\_)+\.)*
(?:\w|\-|\_)+/?)*))*)</code>
$4 – gives the path &amp; filename

<code>(\?(?:\S*))?</code>
$5 – gives parameters, preceeded by “?”

<strong>Comments</strong>:
<ul>
	<li>Yes, I know. It only works for HTTP. Can be easily changed, but I needed it just like this, in order to replace it with a HTML link. You change it to your needs.</li>
	<li>Domain name tries to be restrictive: the last domain part can be between 2 and 5 characters of length (“museum” is the longest one)</li>
	<li>The address cannot end in a dot “.” unless it is the address for a script that takes parameters</li>
	<li>Parameters can only be “restricted” to have only non-spaced characters</li>
	<li>The address starts with the “http://” or with “www.” . Any other address does not match.</li>
</ul>
Now playing: <strong>Black Eyed Peas Feat. Justin Timberlake - Where is the love</strong>]]></content:encoded>

		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>

	<item>
		<title>PNG Transparency</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/2006/06/png-transparency/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 05 Jun 2006 14:54:42 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2006/06/05/png-transparency/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[If you haven’t heard it yet, GIF is bye-gone!

Why? Simply because it supports only binary transparency, and not alpha transparency. This is supported by PNG (Portable Network Graphics).

The only thing about PNG is that the transparency is supported by Internet Explorer (before version 7) only with a “hack”. You need to load the PNG through it’s CSS filter. There are many options, but the two that I found worthy of calling themselves a real solution can be found at <a href="http://homepage.ntlworld.com/bobosola/pngtestfixed.htm">http://homepage.ntlworld.com/bobosola/pngtestfixed.htm</a> (offers a JavaScript solution, by searching IMG tags and replacing as necessary for PNG images) and at <a href="http://webfx.eae.net/dhtml/pngbehavior/pngbehavior.html">http://webfx.eae.net/dhtml/pngbehavior/pngbehavior.html</a> (offers a CSS+Behaviour solution; I find this one better)

Now playing: <strong>(EuropaFM Romania - AACPLUS Stream - 20kbps Mono)</strong>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Graphics vs Web Designer</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/2006/06/graphics-vs-web-designer/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 07 Jun 2006 09:44:15 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2006/06/07/graphics-vs-web-designer/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[I wondered many times what is the main difference between the two, and while it may be obvious for some, it is not for many.

Graphics – … deals with… of course, graphics.

Web – … again… of course, deals with the web.

It wasn’t until yesterday when it hit me. Above all the definitions that may exist over the two types of designer, Graphics designers are the ones that are very much into “what the eyes like” and can distinguish between what needs to be done and what needs to be tried out. Many of us “think properly with the eye” yet do not know what do to, and so… we try this, we try that… in the end, coming to a point where we often say “Hell, it looks shittier than the first version”.

Web designers, on the other hand, are the ones that do the interface for a website. Often enough, they also take care of the programming – that’s a low point. Designers should deal with what is for the feeling, and not with what is for the need. Therefore if you still want to stick to the term “web designer” – there should be “web graphics designer” and “web functionality designer”, the later being the programmer himself.

The thing that happens with the two designers is that often they DO NOT KNOW their limits.

Therefore you see graphics designers doing also web work, meaning that they follow some rules and code a website or a website template, without actually knowing much of the basics. Also, you see web designers doing someone else’s web work, meaning programming, or vice-versa – programmers doing web design.

How it hit me yesterday?… I was going through some templates for WordPress, and I immediately wanted to adapt one of them to my needs. The second I went into the code… pfff. Disaster! The result was….simply building the same template almost from scratch, having almost the same result (due to my needs), but in a cleaner way.

I wonder how we* got to be so selfish, so ego-centric, on a market where SHARE is the main word nowadays. Everything is open-source (let’s give a big applause to Microsoft &amp;others for sticking to keeping to their “strong character and healthy moral backbone”) and stuff can now be shared in a second. Why? Because Internet is all about sharing (information). And since the Internet is the “new sun” of our planet, the “share” is the light coming down on it.

*we – designers, programmers, etc. (we, from the IT world)

It’s one thing to keep your copyright over one thing though, and another to keep the whole idea to yourself, rather than “employing” a proffesional and squeeze the best out of that portion of your idea.

I rest my case… Look at the websites that go round the Internet… 90% of them are full of crap. Not to mention that… let’s say… maybe almost 10% of all are web design groups which emphasize their “skills” and “proffesionalism”, and 90% of those 10% are again.crap.

Bottom line: if someone wants to go a job well, or even take it to its top, let’s share the skills. If we want to get a building done, let’s hire some construction workers… please! Let’s not live in a place we built… I don’t feel comfortable knowing that some graphics/web designers built it…]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<wp:post_date_gmt>2006-06-07 09:44:15</wp:post_date_gmt>

		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>graphics-vs-web-designer</wp:post_name>

			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[0130a15d05716d135b0a64859eb1b8af]]></wp:meta_value>

	</item>
	<item>
		<title>DVD-R and DVD+R</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/2006/06/dvd-r-and-dvdr/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 09 Jun 2006 16:32:19 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2006/06/09/dvd-r-and-dvdr/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>If you burn quite a lot of DVDs then you might have questioned why some DVDs are +R while some are -R. For some the answer is simple. My drive supports only DVD-R, so I&rsquo;m only buying those&hellip;</p>
<p>For the others&hellip; the ones with support for both, the answer is not that simple.</p>
<p>May I say it&rsquo;s totally shitty.</p>
<p>Let&rsquo;s start with standards. DVD-R is the approved version (by DVD Forum), and it was developed by Pioneer in 1997.</p>
<p>The DVD+R one was developed by the so called &ldquo;DVD+RW Alliance&rdquo; in 2002, yet it has not been approved by the DVD Forum.</p>
<p>I don&rsquo;t want to be misunderstood. There&rsquo;s is no standard version!</p>
<p>The &ldquo;plus&rdquo; in the DVD+R(W) is that it offers faster writing, better internal linking.</p>
<p>The bottom line is that DVD-R is the most compatible computer-burning DVD format, while DVD+R has some functional advantages.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>140</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2006-06-09 18:32:19</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2006-06-09 16:32:19</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>dvd-r-and-dvdr</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>publish</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>post</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>

	<item>
		<title>The Bat! - Unknown CA Certificate</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/2006/06/the-bat-unknown-ca-certificate/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 11 Jun 2006 18:51:59 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2006/06/11/the-bat-unknown-ca-certificate/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[If you're having problems while connecting with The Bat! to get your mail through secure channels… meaning that you get a popup window saying that the client couldn't get the certificate, etc.

THEN the answer is to go to your Data folder, and delete IntermCA.ABD and RootCA.ABD.

The software has some troubles accessing those files. It will rebuild them upon the next startup. And it will work OK once again with secure channels.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Missing My Documents/Music/Pictures icons</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/2006/06/missing-my-documentsmusicpictures-icons/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 11 Jun 2006 22:09:23 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2006/06/12/missing-my-documentsmusicpictures-icons/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[If you move your Documents/Music/Pictures or you play with their desktop.ini file then you might end up having "normal" folder icons instead of their special ones. The thing is that usually if you miss those, probably there is some other information not running ok.

In order to fix this, simply open a command prompt and run the following:
<blockquote>rundll32 mydocs.dll,PerUserInit</blockquote>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Zone Alarms - Antivirus Update Error</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/2006/06/zone-alarms-antivirus-update-error/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 13 Jun 2006 08:22:37 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2006/06/13/zone-alarms-antivirus-update-error/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[If you get an update error for the antivirus module, then the answer is simple: somehow the update could not be downloaded, yet ZoneAlarms announces an update.

You need to go to <a href="http://consumerdownloads-west.ca.com/myeTrust/autodownload/modules.txt">http://consumerdownloads-west.ca.com/myeTrust/autodownload/modules.txt</a> and check to see which is the latest version for the Vet.Signatures.

Then go and download http://consumerdownloads-west.ca.com/myeTrust/autodownload/sigs/vet.signatures-XXXX.zip (XXXX means the version number).

Boot into safe mode and replace boot.dat and vet.dat in WINDOWS\System32\ZoneLabs with the ones from the ZIP archive.

This will also solve the issue with having the software up-to-date, yet Security Center issueing warnings about it not being up-to-date.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Hiding the Language Bar for good</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/2006/06/hiding-the-language-bar-for-good/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 16 Jun 2006 07:35:48 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2006/06/16/hiding-the-language-bar-for-good/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[In Windows XP, you noticed that there's a language bar, instead of the old icon in the notification area where you change your keyboard style.

The bar cannot be hidden by simply right-clicking on the taskbar, going to Toolbars, and unchecking "Language Bar". It will come back during the next startup.

To hide it for good, you need to <strong>Control Panel</strong> - <strong>Regional and Language Options</strong>. Click on the <strong>Languages</strong> tab, <strong>Details</strong> button, <strong>Language Bar</strong> button and uncheck Show <strong>Language Bar</strong>.

Click OK.]]></content:encoded>
