	<item>
		<title>Windows Vista</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/2007/06/windows-vista/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 15 Jun 2007 11:06:42 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2007/06/15/windows-vista/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Here goes my experience of installing Windows Vista. I decided to give it a try (x64 version), so inevitably there were things to "learn".

First of all, if there's a need to mention this... No way to get it installed on a USB external HDD.

Secondly... installation was as smooth as possible.

But here go the problems:
<blockquote>I have no idea why, but <strong>installing Adobe Flash ActiveX was a pain in the ass</strong>.
It may have been because I disabled <em>User Access Control</em> and then didn't restart immediately, but every time I tried to install the ActiveX I ended up with the <em>Information Bar</em> in IE7 saying "Your security settings do not allow..., and having only "More Information" on right-click.
Having IE7 as loose as possible, it was still impossible to install it.
Upon restart, having no UAC, it worked this time.</blockquote>
<blockquote><strong>Managing partitions and previous folders.</strong>
I must describe how my system was built:one partition - XP system, one partition - personal data (documents, music, etc.) All "My *" folders were in D:\Documents (My Documents folder). At the end of the HDD, there was some unallocated space (for Vista).
A "big" problem came up - upon booting Vista, the 3rd partition becomes C:, the first one becomes D:, and the 3rd one becomes E:. Since most of the settings of small programes (Winamp, Winace, etc.) which were installed on the former D: had referenced to D: inside their .ini files, it was a problem - now D: was simply my former C:.
Changing drive letters was impossible, because D: was considered a system partition, and you cannot do anything about it.
But there's a very very fine solution, which many of you "loosers" (joke :p) don't know about. NTFS works with "<em>virtual folders</em>" (in UNIX - <em>Symbolic Links</em>), meaning that you can create a folder that will "transparently work" on another folder. All from reading to writing.
Therefore, recreate folders "<em>Documents</em>", "<em>Winace</em>", "<em>Winamp</em>" on the former C: (now D:) and create the links to the former D: (now E:).
I know, I know... I didn't forget: the software that helps you do that is called <a href="http://www.bitsum.com/shjunc.asp">SHJunction</a>. Enjoy and use carefully! :)</blockquote>
<blockquote>What else?... Well.. <strong>Winamp</strong>! Winamp doesn't have full support for Vista. It works, but it has issues. One of them is that you need the some <em>VC++ Runtime  Libraries</em>. Download them from <a href="http://stashbox.org/18587/msvcp71.zip">here </a>and place the dlls where you have <em>winamp.exe</em>.
The other thing is that if you have shared settings (you have Winamp settings in a one directory, and not specific to each user), then you will notice that upon installation Winamp doesn't ask you about that. It has some issues detecting if it can have shared settings or not.
The solution comes from <em>SHJunction </em>again. After installing Winamp, in the "<em>Documents and Settings\{user}\Application Data</em>" you will notice a new directory "Winamp". Just empty that and create a link to the folder where you have the shared Winamp settings. Done!</blockquote>
<blockquote><strong>DivX</strong>. Another type of issue. But also related to dlls. The "Register Products" don't work. For that, you need to download <em>PX.DLL</em> from <a href="http://www.dll-files.com/dllindex/dll-files.shtml?px">here</a>, and copy it to "<em>Windows\SysWOW64</em>", and copy <em>dpuGUI11.dll</em> and <em>dtu100.dll</em> from "<em>Windows\SysWOW64</em>" to "<em>Windows\System32</em>". Done!</blockquote>
More to come as I "learn".
<blockquote><strong>UPDATE - Process Explorer</strong>
If you are so wicked that you replaced your Task Manager with <em>Process Explorer</em>, then on Vista you might have a problem. When you hit "<em>Replace Task Manager</em>", not only it doesn't happen but, but you can't run even the old Task Manager by taskbar right-click or Ctrl-Alt-Del. What happens is that Process Explorer can't match the path to <em>procexp.exe</em> . So.. open <em>regedit</em>, go to <em>HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Image File Execution Options\taskmgr.exe</em> and edit <em>Debugger</em> so that it is the full path to the <em>procexp.exe</em> . Close regedit and give it a try. It works!</blockquote>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>334</wp:post_id>

		<wp:post_date_gmt>2007-06-15 11:06:42</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>

	<item>
		<title>Vista x64 - Learnings</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/2007/06/vista-x64-learnings/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 20 Jun 2007 15:44:43 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2007/06/20/vista-x64-learnings/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[User Account Control (UAC)
<ul>
	<li>Do not go in Control Panel – User Accounts and turn it off. Instead search in Start Menu for “Local Security Policy” or “secpol.msc”, go to Local Policies – Security Options. On the right-side list look for “User Account Control: Behavior of the elevation prompt for administrators in Admin Approval Mode” and change that to “Elevate without prompting”</li>
</ul>
Hibernation, Sleep, etc. – Power Profiles
<ul>
	<li>Before going mad about your computer not hibernating, or acting weird upon sleep, etc. make sure that your BIOS Flash is up-to-date. Well-known manufactures strive to make comprehensive updates continuously (e.g. HP).</li>
	<li>Enable hibernation by typing “powercfg –h on” in an Elevated Command Prompt.</li>
</ul>
Folder related problems
<ul>
	<li>If you use applications that don’t properly detect System folders, then just let them install wherever they want, and then use <a href="http://www.bitsum.com/shjunc.asp">SHJunction</a> to redirect those folders to wherever it is needed.</li>
	<li>Example and solution: Winamp doesn’t detect properly that you can have a Shared Settings Folder, so it automatically start building up a new folder in your Application Data folder. Instead of reconfiguring Winamp, just delete everything inside Application Data\Winamp and link that with SHJunction to your Shared Settings Folder.</li>
	<li>The same solution applies if you’re running two Windows versions. Instead of having software configured twice, just link one folder to the other inside Application Data or Local Settings\Application Data.</li>
	<li>One important thing is to run the software as Administrator. Just right-click – Properties and change Compatibility to “Run as administrator”.</li>
</ul>
DivX
<ul>
	<li>In order to register DivX (fixing the missing dtu100.dll) you should copy dtu100.dll from Windows\SysWow64 to Windows\System32</li>
</ul>
Apache Monitor
<ul>
	<li>Apache install correctly, but upon launching “Apache monitor” you get a “Operation completed successfully” message and the application closes. Just right-click – Properties. Change compatibility to run in a Windows XP SP2 environment.</li>
</ul>
WinACE
<ul>
	<li>If the context menu is not showing for archives, just run WinACE as Administrator and then go into Options and fix file associations!</li>
</ul>
PowerISO
<ul>
	<li>If the context menu is not showing for images, just run PowerISO as Administrator and then go into Options and fix file associations!</li>
</ul>
Yahoo Messenger
<ul>
	<li>For now, it seems like it doesn’t detect webcams ?! Though Live and Skype do!</li>
</ul>
Mouse
<ul>
	<li>If your mouse doesn’t have drivers/software for Vista (x64) and you miss giving other meanings to the extra buttons, then just download <a href="http://www.highrez.co.uk/downloads/XMouseButtonControl.htm">XMouseButtonControl</a> and go with that. Remember that in order to act on elevated applications, you must elevate (run as administrator) XMouseButtonControl.</li>
	<li></li>
</ul>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Systran6 - Word</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/2007/06/systran6-word/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 23 Jun 2007 10:02:11 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2007/06/23/systran6-word/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Weird enough, but in Vista, when starting Office Word, you get a couple of seconds/minutes freeze up of the application. The reason is the Systran6 addin. In Excel or Powerpoint – no problem, but in Word… The same happens when you want to exit Word.

In order to disable it, just run Word as Administrator, go to Office Menu – Word Options, then to Add-ins and Manage COM Add-ins and disable Systran6.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Keyboard Layouts?!</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/2007/06/keyboard-layouts/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 24 Jun 2007 17:50:47 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2007/06/24/keyboard-layouts/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Right, so Vista should be so international that you can blow yourself up as an Irishman, and you end up a Chinese.

Hmm… aren’t we talking about Microsoft!?

The thing is that several applications simply don’t follow the international charsets. For instance Yahoo Messenger in Vista – when I press ş, ţ or ă come out as s, t and a. But it works for â and î.

Amazingly enough, if you go to Preferences, and change through some fonts, and at some moment (no real solution so far, just randomly changing them) you will notice, that those 3 diacritics do show up. Again randomly, that “feature” dissappears.

The same thing happens in Total Commander.

Don’t you love, Vista?

[LATER EDIT]
Ok, so this is an official BUG! I found it <a href="http://www.secarica.ro/html/info_winvista.html">here</a> (Romanian), and that lead to <a href="http://blogs.msdn.com/shawnste/archive/2007/03/19/some-keyboards-fail-with-ansi-applications-on-windows-vista-rtm.aspx">here</a>. But there’s no solution. Other than just waiting for a fix! This bug affects all ANSI applications :(

[LATER EDIT]
Bug fixed. You can download it <a href="http://thehotfixshare.net/board/index.php?automodule=downloads&amp;showfile=2640">here</a> for x86 and <a href="http://thehotfixshare.net/board/index.php?automodule=downloads&amp;showfile=2753">here</a> for x64.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Computer free due to..</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/2007/06/computer-free-due-to/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 28 Jun 2007 22:17:38 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2007/06/29/computer-free-due-to/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[due to: curiosity + HP + BIOS upgrade + Vista.
So for now I'm enjoying quite a computer-free life :D
<blockquote><span class="Text">				 			 			 			Scenario: preparing for a Vista tryout. One of the upgrades is for BIOS - going to F.28
After upgrading BIOS and installing Vista, a couple of times the computer froze and upon a hard restart, the nothing happened.

Symptomps: upon powering up the laptop, the LEDs are turned on (weird enough the card reader LED stays on), the DVD-ROM spins, the HDD is initialized, but nothing more. The HP logo doesn't appear.

Arbitrary recovery: the first time, after taking out the battery, and powering only by AC, the computer started OK. The second time, the trick didn't do it.

Thoughts? Similar scenarios?

PS: I already tried reseating the RAM modules, did a power drain..
PS2: What's even nicer is that Pavilions are not sold here, so in order to repair it (it still has warranty) I need to take it back to where I bought it!</span></blockquote>]]></content:encoded>

			<wp:comment_id>352</wp:comment_id>
			<wp:comment_author><![CDATA[&#8220;Friends&#8221; in misery &laquo; Andrie]]></wp:comment_author>
			<wp:comment_author_email></wp:comment_author_email>

			<wp:comment_content><![CDATA[[...] are going through the same ordeal.  So you power up the notebook and all you get is a blank screen. Everything goes down to BIOS [...] ]]></wp:comment_content>
			<wp:comment_approved>1</wp:comment_approved>
			<wp:comment_type>pingback</wp:comment_type>
			<wp:comment_parent>0</wp:comment_parent>
			<wp:comment_user_id>0</wp:comment_user_id>
		</wp:comment>

	<item>
		<title>Swedish HP Support</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/2007/08/swedish-hp-support/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 02 Aug 2007 12:25:24 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2007/08/02/swedish-hp-support/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[More or less like a counter-part to <a href="http://www.andressa.ro/2007/08/clientul-nu-are-niciodata-dreptate-nu-mai-incercati.html">Andressa's post</a>, here I go with HP support in Sweden. Call it Swedish vs. Romanian. The goods and bads.

So.. baby-laptop went dead, and since it's a Pavilion they cannot fix in Romania, 'cause it's not marketed there. I ended up with it back to Sweden, where I bought it from.

Yesterday I think I've stayed on the phone with a guy from HP for an hour altogether. I called in, at first, and I basically started to play dumm, because I was really dumm. A friend called in before and just told me that when I reach Sweden, I should just call in and tell them a reference number and set up the time when a pick-up service will come for the laptop.

Said and done, so.. calling and saying "A friend called before, the reference number is xxxxxx... so what's next?:)".. the guy answers "Nothing really :) Pretty much all just that you have to send in a proof of purchase. Just fax it right now, and I will call you back right away".

The laptop was purschased on another name, so... since the guy forgot to ask for the specific number from where I was calling... he called that person, then called the husband of that person, and then reached me at the office :) After that whole trip, the guy was still virtually smiling at the other end of the line.

I tried to explain to him the situation, that I must get back to Romania, etc, etc. And asked him whether there is not any chance of speeding things up (pick-up in 2 days, repairs in about 10, etc)? I even joked whether they don't have a special programme for peace-workers... :)

Anyway... after clearing out most things, I also asked if its possible to do a RAM upgrade in-house, and the guy was blocked. Me:"I'm really giving you a hard time, right?:)" He:":))) Kind of. I really don't know what to say but I will check that out, and come back to you, ok?:)" After half an hour, calls back for the 4th, 5th time.. Having a happy voice once again "Ok, I figured it out. The boys said it's ok, but you will have to call in directly at the HP service-shop and make the request yourself, because no matter how much I tried, I cannot put in the order for you along the repair-request".

Therefore.. in Sweden, you can joke with the operators almost anytime, as most of them are genuinely friendly... On the other hand, services can be as lousy as anywhere. But I will go for Swedish jokes and more repair-time, since altogethere it keeps you sane!

PS: So tomorrow, they will pick it up, and then... It's a wait&amp;see game.
<p style="text-align:right;font-size:8px;">Blogged with <a href="http://www.flock.com/blogged-with-flock" title="Flock" target="_new">Flock</a></p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Realitatea.net - live audio</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/2007/08/realitateanet-live-audio/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 23 Aug 2007 14:27:21 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2007/08/23/realitateanet-live-audio/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[First of all, congrats! The main news channel in Romania now broadcasts live audio. Being a news channel, I find it quite common sense that the image doesn't bring that much added value.

I may have nothing to do with their decision to develop this, but still.. on June 1st, 2007 I have wrote them suggesting the exact same thing . I won't translate it into English, but here it is for all Romanian speakers:
<blockquote>Written on Friday, June 1, 2007, 3:13:50 PM.
To: office@realitatea.net

Bună ziua!

Vin cu o sugestie în ceea ce priveşte transmisia Live a <span class="st">Realitatea</span> TV.

Datorită faptului că informaţia vizuală este benefică, dar nu şi vitală, vă propun să aveţi un "shoutcast"/o transmisie live audio, fără să fie cuplat cu feed-ul video.

Nu ştiu măsura în care am dreptate, dar cred că sunt destui aceea care stau la birou, sau în oricare altă locaţie unde televizorul nu este disponibil, şi au o conexiune la transmisia dvs. live dar din motive obiective (spaţiul de lucru al calculatorului, necesitatea unei atenţii vizuale maxime, etc.) nu au fereastra cu feed-ul live, sau un media player always-on-top.

Sper urmare oricum informaţia vizuală este neglijată.

Odată cu introducerea unui feed audio, aţi putea mări şi plaja dvs. de audienţă. Conexiunea Internet pentru live audio nu necesită conexiuni broadband, astfel că cerinţele tehnice scad şi puteţi să aveţi utilizatori mai mulţi.

Pe scurt, vă rog să luaţi în considerare un fel de RealitateaTV - Internet Radio.

Vă mulţumesc anticipat,
Andrei</blockquote>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Vista - Blocked Startup Programs</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/2007/08/vista-blocked-startup-programs/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 26 Aug 2007 21:42:16 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2007/08/26/vista-blocked-startup-programs/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[So.. you get that annoying pop-up in the taskbar every time you boot up your shinny Vista?

The glitch is to remove that programme from startup - use "msconfig" (search for it in the Start Menu Search).

Then seach for "task" in the Start Menu as well - and run "Task Scheduler".

You will then need to create a new task. On the right you have "Create basic task"... you will definitely find your way.
<ul>
	<li>Give it a name</li>
	<li>Trigger: When I log on</li>
	<li>Action: Start a program (&amp; select the program)</li>
	<li>Finish: Open Open the Properties dialog for this task when I click on Finish</li>
</ul>
Check "Run with highest privileges" and then under Settings tab, "Run this task as soon as possible after a schedule start was missed".

Done!

And no, there is no other easier way.. yet!]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Pidgin</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/2007/08/pidgin/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 29 Aug 2007 18:46:08 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2007/08/29/pidgin/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[I must say that I started to ... like Pidgin!

I think the only thing that was driving me away were the Yahoo! Emoticons, but hey.. you can port them to Pidgin.

<img class="alignright size-full wp-image-376" title="pidgin 2" src="http://blog.andreineculau.com/wp-content/uploads/2007/08/pidgin12.png" alt="pidgin 2" width="180" height="60" />What is <a href="http://www.pidgin.im">Pidgin</a>? Pidgin is a free multi-protocol messenger. So with very very little resources, I'm logged on to MSN/Live, Yahoo, ICQ, Google Talk and oh well.. I have a freakin Gadu-Gadu account :p

Well, you have file transfer and all. You don't have voice. But for all of you Russians out there, there's support for Cyrillic Transliterated - yeah! that cool thing that you love when you don't have a Russian keyboard :)

<span style="text-decoration: line-through;">And.. oh well.. you cannot set your visibility on each account, but on all accounts - either visible, either invisible. Same with status messages. But I think there's somebody working on that :p</span>It is actually possible with one plugin from the pack out here - <a href="http://plugins.guifications.org/trac/wiki/PluginPack">http://plugins.guifications.org/trac/wiki/PluginPack</a> .

<span style="text-decoration: line-through;">But hey.. </span>just download <a href="http://wiki.andreineculau.com/Original_Smileys_Theme_for_Pidgin">the all in one emoticon pack</a> and enjoy! :) You have your Gtalk, ICQ, Yahoo, MSN, AIM and Gadu-Gadu icons available, and Pidgin detects which to use in what environment.

The world just got smaller at no price (in comparison to Trillian).

PS: you have tabbed chatting as well

[LATER EDIT - 2007-10-09]
What I'm missing is a working "song tracker" plugin (there are 2, but one is not doing anything, the other is crashing) and there should be a plugin to associate the "buddies" (accounts) of the same person - other the same network, or different networks (similar like Yahoo! does)

[LATER EDIT - 2007-10-14]
New all-in-one emoticon pack]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>for the sensible-me</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/2007/09/for-the-sensible-me/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 30 Sep 2007 07:07:02 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2007/09/30/for-the-sensible-me/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[I don't get how people take advantage of one another. Period.

But what is even more out of this world for me.. how can you take advantage of someone who you already know that he/she won't yell at you, or that will try to make the impossible possible and find the truth in what you're saying, and seldomly even "overwrite" his/her own truth?

I don't see the point in turning into an ass that needs to yell in order to make myself understood. I don't even want to put pressure on people. But when this is becoming a danger to my own expression, well.. fuck it.

In the end, will I be a better person if I "over-care" for other people's thoughts&amp;feelings while they don't care about mine?

"Be honest" is the motto, but what if I cannot be honest when my sayings will be taken as an offensive measure?]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>388</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2007-09-30 09:07:02</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2007-09-30 07:07:02</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>for-the-sensible-me</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>publish</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>post</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>

		<category domain="category" nicename="phylosophy"><![CDATA[Phylosophy]]></category>

	<item>
		<title>Doable and not Doable</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/2007/10/doable-and-not-doable/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 11 Oct 2007 18:07:39 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2007/10/11/doable-and-not-doable/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[My <em><strong>smartness</strong></em> speaking now: when there are things not going your way, how do you decide if you fight or not? How to you decide if it's doable or not doable?

Something are nevertheless out of reach. I mean.. you already know that what you do can shake, but not change the situation. It's like in that myth where you cannot change the far future, only the near future. That stupid movie where they try to change something, hoping that the domino pieces won't continue their course, but instead what happens is that they only shifted the domino course, and that piece that they want to avoid will still fall down.

My <em>cowardness</em> speaking now: why not just make sure that those other things, the very doable things, are going your way?

<!--more-->

I mean, if you can't be sure of the unsure, make sure you make the possible real. Leave out the impossible. It may be that the impossible will fall into its place. You can hope for that, or you can just be surprised by that. It's zen-like:do what you know it's best, and don't expect the best to happen to you.

My <em>dreamyness</em> speaking now: don't stop being a mighty duck. <a href="http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0104868/">Mighty Ducks</a> need to win. And they win. You shouldn't even watch the movie if you know the ending. But you watch it. Because it's not that they win that counts. That's more like for your good-night dreaming - to go to bed knowing that the evil was put to rest. Even if they lose, you would still have the same feeling, and you would go out there to show everyone that you can be a duck, that you are not someone to be trashed.. Well, at least these few of us that have some non-glossy brain and soul think so.

No conclusion whatsoever. You choose what's best for you. That's it: you choose! You do not know what's best for you most of the times, for those <em>big</em> decisions.

But most probable it's good to go with big smartness, or big cowardness, or big dreamyness.

I go with...
... <strong>straightness</strong> =)

I didn't play any tricks on you, people - straightness is in those 3 options: it's big smartness AND big cowardness AND big dreamyness. It hurts the most when it doesn't go right, but the winning might be.. not great, but 100% real.

<strong>Great is the new "fine", and real is the new "great".</strong> So make your small step - when someone asks you "How are you?", don't start or at least don't stop at "I'm good/fine/great!". Give a real answer, put yourself out there.

PS: although cowardness and dreamyness are not in the dictionary that doesn't mean they are not real, or equal in some way to smartness

PS2: this post is not at all about that small "How are you?" thing]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Vista without IPv6</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/2007/10/vista-without-ipv6/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 14 Oct 2007 07:49:59 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2007/10/14/vista-without-ipv6/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Not all equipments support <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IPv6">IPv6</a>, and therefore cause problems - limited access, often network disconnections, etc.

In Vista, IPv6 is enabled by default, but given the current status - a very tiny part uses IPv6 - you should be able to disable its support without any disadvantages at all.

So here's how to do it.
<ol>
	<li><strong>Start Menu</strong></li>
	<li>Right click on <strong>Computer</strong>, select <strong>Manage</strong></li>
	<li>Left Side List: click on <strong>Device Manager</strong></li>
	<li>Application Menu: <strong>View </strong>-&gt; <strong>Show hidden devices</strong></li>
	<li>In the main list, under <strong>Network Adapters</strong>, you should now see <em>6to4</em>, <em>isatap.[..]</em>, <em>Teredo Tunneling Pseudo-Interface</em></li>
	<li>Right click on each of them, and select <strong>Disable</strong></li>
</ol>
All set. A computer restart would be nice though. Good luck!]]></content:encoded>

		<title>Pidgin 2 Betas</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/2007/10/pidgin-2-betas/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 14 Oct 2007 22:54:22 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2007/10/15/pidgin-2-betas/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[If you want to check out the prerelease (MTN) builds of Pidgin you can go <a href="http://geddeth.dk/downloads/pidgin/">here</a>.

After downloading the package.. you should back up your Program Files\Pidgin and also Documents and Settings\{user} \Application Data\.pidgin .. and extract to Program Files\Pidgin

This way you could enjoy the benefits of new releases, earlier then when the milestone is reached.

PS:I'm now using a version of <a href="http://bomahy.nl/hylke/blog/7-reasons-to-look-forward-to-pidgin-221/">Pidgin</a> which incorporates MSNP v14 (e.g. support for status messages on MSN)]]></content:encoded>

			<wp:comment_date_gmt>2007-10-16 13:59:46</wp:comment_date_gmt>
			<wp:comment_content><![CDATA[It's much easier to use quick and dirty solution like this one I wrote.

<code>
#!/usr/bin/env python

import os
import commands

status = commands.getoutput('audtool playback-status')

if status == 'playing':
	artist = commands.getoutput('audtool current-song-tuple-data performer')
	title = commands.getoutput('audtool current-song-tuple-data track_name')
	commands.getoutput('purple-remote "setstatus?status=available&amp;message=' \
		+ artist + ' - ' + title + '"')
else:
	os.system('purple-remote "setstatus?status=available&amp;message="')
</code>
Make cron execute this script once in 5 seconds and that's it.]]></wp:comment_content>

	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Scrisoare către generaţia noastră</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/2007/10/scrisoare-catre-generatia-noastra/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 16 Oct 2007 09:42:54 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2007/10/16/scrisoare-catre-generatia-noastra/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>* primită ca mass, primul care l-am dat mai departe</p> <p>Născuți la începutul anilor 60-80, vedem acum în anul 2006 cum casa părinţilor noștri este de 50 de ori mai scumpă decât atunci când au cumpărat-o şi realizăm că noi o să plătim pentru casele noastre în jur de 50 de ani. Nu avem amintiri despre primii pași pe lună, nici despre războaie sângeroase, dar avem cultura generală, pentru că asta însemna ceva odată. </p><p>Suntem ultima generație care a jucat "Ascunselea", "Castel", "Ratele şi vânătorii", "Ţară, ţară! Vrem ostași", "Prinsea", "Sticluța cu otravă","Pac Pac", "Hoții şi vardiștii", ultimii care au strigat "Un doi trei la perete stai", ultimii care au folosit telefoanele cu fise, dar primii care am făcut petreceri video (închiriam un video şi stăteam să ne uităm la filme 2 zile închişi în casă) primii care am văzut desene animate color, primii care am renunțat la casete audio şi le-am înlocuit cu cd-uri.</p>
<!--more-->
 <p> </p><p>Noi am purtat jeanşi elastici, pantaloni evazați, geci de blugi de la turci, iar cine avea firme gen Lee sau Puma era deja lider de gaşcă. </p><p>Noi nu am dat examene de Capacitate, nu am dat teste grile la admitere. Noi am fost ultimii "Șoimi ai Patriei" şi ultimii "Pioneri". </p><p>La grădinița am învăţat poezii în românește, nu în engleză... Şi am cântat MULŢI ANI TRĂIASCĂ, nu HAPPY BIRTHDAY la aniversări. </p><p>Am sorbit din ochi Sclava Isaura, Beverly Hills, Melrose Place, Twin Peaks, Dallas.. şi cine zice că nu s-a uitat ori minte ori nu avea încă televizor.  </p><p>Reclamele de pe posturile străine ne înnebuneau, şi abia așteptam să vină şi la noi înghețata Magnum, sau puștile alea absolut superbe de apa. </p><p>Între timp, ne consolam cu Tango cu vanilie şi ciocolată şi clasicele bidoane umplute cu apă de la robinet, care turnate în cap ne provocau pneumonii. </p><p>Şi uite un motiv bun să nu mergem la școală. </p><p>Noi am ascultat şi Metallica, şi Ace of Base, şi DJ Bobo, şi Michael Jackson, şi Backstreet Boys, şi Take That, şi încă nu auzisem de manele, singurele melodii de joc fiind horele la chefuri, la care nimeni nu știa pașii, dar toți dansam! Dar spre deosebire de copiii din ziua de azi, am auzit atât de Abba, şi de Queen, cât şi de noile nume gen 50 Cent şi Britney Spears. Am citit "Licurici", "Pif", Cireșarii, şi am băut Cico şi Zmeurata şi ni s-a părut ceva extraordinar când au apărut primele sucuri "de la TEC" fără să ne fie teamă că "au prea multe E-uri", iar la școală beam toată clasa dintr-o sticlă de suc fără teama de viruși. </p><p>Noi am băut prima Coca-Cola la sticlă şi am descoperit internetul.  </p><p>Noi nu ne dădeam bip-uri, ne fluieram să ieșim afară, noi nu aveam dolby surround system, tăceam toți ca să auzim acțiunea filmului, nu aveam Nintendo sau Playstation ci jocuri tetris de care ne plictiseam la o luna după ce le cumpăram şi le uitam pe dulap, pline de praf. </p><p>Abia așteptam la chefuri să jucăm "Fântâniţa", sau "Flori, fete sau băieți", sau "Adevăr sau Provocare", sau orice ne dădea un pretext să "pupăm pe gură" pe cine "iubeam". Noi suntem cei care încă au mai "cerut prietenia", care încă roșeam la cuvântul "sex", care dădeam cu banul care să intre în farmacie să cumpere prezervative, pe care apoi să le umplem cu apă şi să le aruncăm în capul colegilor, care am completat mii de oracole, sperând ca persoana iubită va citi acolo unde scrie "De cine îţi place?" că ne place de el/ea.  </p><p>Este uimitor că încă mai suntem în viață, pentru că noi am mers cu bicicleta fără cască, genunchiere şi cotiere, nu am avut scaune speciale în mașini, nu am aruncat la gunoi bomboanele care ne cădeau din greșeală pe jos, nu am avut pastile cu capac special să nu fie desfăcute de copii, nu ne-am spălat pe mâini după ce ne-am jucat cu toți câinii şi toate pisicile din cartier, nu am ținut cont de câte lipide şi glucide mâncam, părintii noștri nu au "child-proofed the house", ne-au trimis să cumpăram bere şi vin de la alimentară, şi câte un pachet de ţigări de la tutungerie. </p><p>Noi am auzit cum s-a tras la Revoluție, noi am fost martorii a trei schimbări de bancnote şi monede, noi am râs la bancuri cu Bulă, noi am fost primii care au auzit-o pe Andreea Esca la Pro TV, noi suntem cei care mai ținem minte emisiunea "Feriți-vă de măgăruş". </p><p>Suntem o generație de învingători, de visători, de "first-timers".. </p><p><strong>Daca citești şi ai căzut măcar un pic pe gânduri, ești de-al nostru!</strong></p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>4-3-2, My/Our Roots!</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/2007/10/4-3-2-myour-roots/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 18 Oct 2007 08:19:58 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2007/10/18/4-3-2-myour-roots/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[* <strike>Review</strike> Post-attitude of <strong><a href="http://imdb.com/title/tt1032846/">4 months, 3 weeks, 2 days</a> - Cristian Mungiu</strong>
<strong>* Part ONE (<a href="/?p=414">Click here to go to Head article</a>)
</strong>

I don't really know if this post should be written in Romanian or English, but I'm going with English without any true reason behind it.

<strong>So 17th of October will be "remembered" as the day when I understood.</strong>

<strong>I understood where I/we have my/our roots.</strong> Where WE, Romanians of present post-communist Romania, have our roots : self-evidently in the pre-communist Romania (better yet, in the pre-communist Romania<strong>ns</strong>). So far I have lived with the feeling/thought/hope that we weren't so worthless pushy, so self-centered beings, so ignorantly self-punishing, so <em>fun of life</em>-makers (or life-coolers as I thought just know).. before the Revolution and that we became like such afterwards.

<!--more-->
<blockquote>It was stupid to think like that.. To think that the Romanian life had a crash, a crack during the Revolution. It is today's adults fault that they cannot communicate that any better. Wherever whenever a "kid" is considering the revolution as a normal thing to happen, the response is the usual "You don't know how it was.. You'd better be grateful for what you're living now. We had such a troubled life back then".

And it was a troubled life - but that doesn't exclude the present situation - present is as troubled as it was then, just that within other limits, other dimensions.. what a pity many of them are still shared between the past and the present.

<strong>The '89 Revolution didn't change things in a second.</strong> It simply didn't, but we (youth) are still taken as fouls because we "cannot understand", as if we didn't live the changing times, as if we don't have a past "me" but only a present "me" while the adults have both. A lot of that incapacity to "understand" is due to lack of explanation - those who have lived during that period cannot understand fully either, and they certainly lack the ability to communicate any of that piece that they understood so far.

Getting back to my/our roots - isn't that you can hear a lot today about our roots being in the Balkan culture, in the Byzantine culture, in the Latin culture, etc? We hear that we are so rich in culture, simply because we come from Latines (French, Italians, Spanish), Slavs (Russians) let alone Germans, Turks, etc. And for better or for worse you put that reason as the center of the richness, but also the center of the craziness/foolishness and lack of identity.

And thus you ignore what was during the communism - you have this image that life was having a more normal pace back then, and that the nation didn't have the means to enjoy their diversity, but that they were at least respecting life.

<strong>Those were my thoughts, my reasons for what I see today in us Romanians - lack of capacity to live with our cultural diversity and to enjoy it, correlated with the impression that we "broke down" after the Revolution brought "freedom".</strong>

BUT - before the revolution:
<ul>
	<li>You had the same clerks - not listening to your needs, trying to act useful, treating you like dirt</li>
	<li>You had the same queues - back then at "Alimentara", now at supermarkets</li>
	<li>You had the same talks at family/friendly gatherings - about nothing, about how it was, about how it should be, about how to, about how not to - TALK, TALK, TALK</li>
	<li>You had the same parenting - "Let me tell you how it is, because you don't know anything, son"/"On my days, teenagers had more shame.."</li>
	<li>You had the same Police - staying over for a smoke and chit-chat with other no-goods</li>
	<li>You had the same parties - ending up in stupid fights</li>
</ul>
</blockquote>
<em>Context Finish
</em>The Romanian world didn't change right after the Revolution. We got to be who we are today in a long term, and it won't take 17 years but much much more than that to turn ourselves into a nation with respect for, with dignity in front of, with love of LIFE, FUN, GOOD, but most of all, of Human Beings. React now!

PS: Ana, Lumi, Andreea - ;) You know what!

<a href="/?p=412">CONTINUE reading part TWO..</a>]]></content:encoded>

	</item>
	<item>
		<title>4-3-2, Sacrifice!</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/2007/10/4-3-2-sacrifice/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 18 Oct 2007 09:34:55 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2007/10/18/4-3-2-sacrifice/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[* <strike>Review</strike> Post-attitude of <strong><a href="http://imdb.com/title/tt1032846/">4 months, 3 weeks, 2 days</a> - Cristian Mungiu</strong>
<strong>* Part TWO (<a href="/?p=414">Click to go to Head article</a>)
</strong>

<strong>So 17th of October will be "remembered" as the day when I understood.</strong>

<strong>I understood the pain of being on top of the situation, the pain of sacrifice.</strong> Sometimes you simply need to sacrifice yourself, your dreams, your needs. Never your ideals though, never your conscience! You need to sacrifice for the people you care for, in their best interest. You might end up doing it for people you don't care for as well. You will hate yourself for not understanding why, but you will love yourself for doing it... if you do it.

<!--more-->
<blockquote><strong>Otilia was my main story. The abortion was just the context to put all her actions and reactions together.</strong> This girl has such a raw perspective of reality, of what it is needed, of what it is not needed.. so harsh, so bloody even.. that you only give her your hand and tell her "I know!.." and sigh along with her.

I won't give details about the movie, because I would want as many people to see it. I don't see it as the "coolest" movie to go to, and I'm not even going to say it is the best one - it is simply not the point. I don't think that Cristian Mungiu&amp;Co. wanted that - I think they targeted reality and not a reality-show. One does not grow inside, does not develop by looking at reality-shows, by looking inside other peoples lives without understanding the reasons behind it. One grows as a human being by facing reality. 4-3-2 makes us grow by looking at a very small and powerful reality of one teen day during Romanian communism.

3000 lei - during those times it was so much!!! Yet she is treating that money like a mean of getting what you want - she puts them in the back-pocket, she then throws them in the bag as just another thing to put in the bag. She is so cold when she gets the room at the other hotel.. so.. on top of the situation. She goes to talk to the guy, she tries to mediate the money-talk, she does what is obviously the only thing to do when money are lacking, she starts talking with her boyfriend about their situation, she is the one that doesn't say anything over dinner at the birthday party, she is the one that is ending it all.

And in the end, she is mesmerized at the fact that.. she made it so easy for Găbiţa. She made it so easy that her friend doesn't even realize the sacrifice. While the experience is traumatizing, there is not even a glimpse of regret or gratitude.. only a simple "Thanks" and a worthless defensive talk with the one that sacrificed so much.

<strong>SO MUCH!</strong>

I cannot even tell you <strong>how much</strong> I identified with her - not because I have made huge sacrifices or such. I made mine, with or without a strong will, with or without expecting something in return.. It's not that. It was her power to keep shut and continue what she knew is best in a situation where she didn't have the answers.

<strong>How much</strong> she had to endure.. the strive to make it happen - both energy and physical involvement, the useless embarrassment at the birthday party, the visuals she had to see, the loneliness she had to go through, the fucked up feeling of seeing others' stupidity.

She did <strong>not</strong> expect <strong>anything</strong> in return after all this. She did it for her own soul-conscience and for her own sake. So that she knows afterwards that she did everything humanly possible.

She was already grown up in the start of the movie, but she was blown away by how much she grew up during these few days. <strong>She gave so much</strong>, and received nothing but dirt.</blockquote>
<em>Context Finish
</em>We seldom realize the sacrifice that others do for us. We often realize the sacrifice we do for others and expect things in return. We like to peak through the door's keyhole, but we never put the hand on the door handle and enter. We say "Auch!" for the smallest pain, almost unnoticeable pain, while others break their teeth by how much they keep their mouth shut while they suffer. We forgot to be real in pain, and also in joy. We open up so much, that we invent situations/feelings/thoughts just so we keep open, and we close ourselves so much that we rarely put ourselves out there - for our own good at least, if not for somebody else. Am I wrong?

<a href="/?p=413">CONTINUE reading part THREE...</a>]]></content:encoded>

		<wp:post_name>4-3-2-sacrifice</wp:post_name>

		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>

		<category domain="category" nicename="phylosophy"><![CDATA[Phylosophy]]></category>
		<category domain="category" nicename="romania"><![CDATA[Romania]]></category>
		<category domain="category" nicename="social"><![CDATA[Social]]></category>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key>_sexybookmarks_shortUrl</wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[http://tinyurl.com/yaeh8s3]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key>_sexybookmarks_permaHash</wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[624e534c5c45a4d075e17cc5f91e1593]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:comment>
			<wp:comment_id>452</wp:comment_id>
			<wp:comment_author><![CDATA[4-3-2 - Movie Article Trilogy &laquo; Andrie]]></wp:comment_author>
			<wp:comment_author_email></wp:comment_author_email>
			<wp:comment_author_url>http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2007/10/18/4-3-2-movie-article-trilogy/</wp:comment_author_url>
			<wp:comment_author_IP>72.232.131.31</wp:comment_author_IP>
			<wp:comment_date>2007-10-19 12:09:14</wp:comment_date>
			<wp:comment_date_gmt>2007-10-19 10:09:14</wp:comment_date_gmt>
			<wp:comment_content><![CDATA[[...] 4-3-2, Sacrifice!Part TWO.. [...] ]]></wp:comment_content>
			<wp:comment_approved>1</wp:comment_approved>
			<wp:comment_type>pingback</wp:comment_type>
			<wp:comment_parent>0</wp:comment_parent>
			<wp:comment_user_id>0</wp:comment_user_id>
		</wp:comment>
	</item>
	<item>
		<title>4-3-2, the Movie!</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/2007/10/4-3-2-the-movie/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 18 Oct 2007 14:27:03 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2007/10/18/4-3-2-the-movie/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[* <strike>Review</strike> Post-attitude of <strong><a href="http://imdb.com/title/tt1032846/">4 months, 3 weeks, 2 days</a> - Cristian Mungiu</strong>
<strong>* Part THREE (<a href="/?p=414">Click here to go to Head article</a>)
</strong>

<strong>So 17th of October will be "remembered" as the day when I understood.</strong>

<strong>I understood the message we have (can) tell.</strong> On the way out from the cinema, there was at least a small thought in each viewer's head - Is that all that we can tell? Don't we have anything to tell? Anything other than communist-era stories? Are we nothing else than a post-communist country for the Western world that we incorporated this idea and we focus on that?

<!--more-->
<blockquote>The answer is clear for me:now. I admit that I didn't think of these questions. I went so much into the movie's main character, Otilia, that I couldn't think of something else. But I acknowledged the need to think about these as well.

It is quite true.. after Sergiu Nicolaescu's non-movies, we had only
<ul>
	<li>communism-related movies
<em>California Dreamin', A fost sau n-a fost, Hârtia va fi albastră</em></li>
	<li>countryside-related / post-communism related
<em>Filantropica, Moartea domnului Lăzărescu</em></li>
</ul>
Is it that we look only into exotic scripts? or is it merely the fact that during that period, and immediately afterwards we didn't have the means to put that on film.

Before '89 we had only life-related or love-related stories, and what I mean is that movies were a bit (we can argue) part of the communist utopia. Nobody spoke about the queues for bread and milk, nobody spoke about the illegal abortions, nobody spoke about the small smuggling of foreign products. Nobody could speak about that.

<strong>It is only now that we are experiencing freedom</strong> - politically speaking, my opinion is that we had a small shock 1996-2000, but that we are free enough only since 2003-2005 - if you want to argue let's please start from the premise that Iliescu was not what we needed right after the revolution, and let's not start having that "It could have been worse" reply.

Freedom is not only the horizon to do stuff, but the real possibility to do stuff. The freedom not to be able to choose between becoming a doctor or a chemist, but the possibility to become one without any pressure other than your own will.

So I feel good and proud actually that the topic is not left in the dark, only because there was so much time between the moment of actual fact and the moment of actual possibility to relate the fact. We should explore that in a more personal level - each of us should reflect on those times, on past.

<strong>I have to say that Cristian Mungiu really made it possible to breath along the characters </strong>with his idea of using long shooting. You never realize it, unless you are aware of that before going to the cinema. That is why it is so good - it feels very natural. One of the most real scenes, without any emotional implications was the scene at the birthday party - maybe I was too much into the movie, but I didn't find it at all abnormal. It was my own self-protection that disconnected me from the scene and made me look at her and become aware of what she is going through.

I think of all the moments, again non-emotional, or non-harsh, the finale was phenomenal. You don't leave the place as if you were leaving a cinema, but an experience - you leave an experience.</blockquote>
<em>Context Finish</em>
I cannot compare this movie with anything else. It is not great, it is not super, it is not a "must see", it is not a "how can you leave without it?". No, I'm not making a mistake - this movie is simply not a cliché, therefore no cliché should be used when referring to it.
It is simple, beautiful, raw - real. Nothing can beat reality!

PS: I wanted to say this a long time - since I was on a plain and I read in Financial Times Magazine about the new real thing coming from Eastern Europe in terms of movie making - <strong>THANK YOU, CRISTIAN MUNGIU</strong>!

PS2: Without any less gratitude, thank you
<ul>
	<li>Anamaria Marinca</li>
	<li>Laura Vasiliu</li>
	<li>Vlad Ivanov</li>
</ul>]]></content:encoded>

			<wp:comment_content><![CDATA[I too felt the same way about 4,3,2. A moving experience, as if the story were first person. That's how connected I felt to what Otilia was going through. I wrote a full review if you want to read it. Maybe you can tell me how accurate I am. The more I see cinema from other countries (mine being USA) the more I feel like the people are more similar than most people want to believe. It's so very easy to see someone else from another country as "foreign" when many times they can go through and react to a very similar situation. While we have the freedom to abort, it may not be around long, and whether there's freedom involved or not, it's an emotional journey most women are not fully prepared to take, as Dragut didn't seem to be. Seeing movies like this always grounds me to the fact that there are more similarities than differences and it would be a good thing for more people to recognize this.

I also saw "Persepolis" recently. It gave me the same feeling of perspective. I haven't written my piece on that though, it was only last night I saw it.]]></wp:comment_content>

		<title>4-3-2 - Movie Article Trilogy</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/2007/10/4-3-2-movie-article-trilogy/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 18 Oct 2007 16:47:01 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2007/10/18/4-3-2-movie-article-trilogy/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[* <strike>Review</strike> Post-attitude of <b><a href="http://imdb.com/title/tt1032846/">4 months, 3 weeks, 2 days</a> - Cristian Mungiu</b>

<b>So 17th of October will be "remembered" as the day when I understood.
This is one of the few things that I wrote fully convinced that it is something to be read by others.</b>

I wrote a small "trilogy" and I think I captured quite well my feeling about the whole experience:
<ul>
	<li><a href="http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2007/10/18/4-3-2-myour-roots/"><b>4-3-2, My/Our Roots!</b></a>

.</li>
	<li><a href="http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2007/10/18/4-3-2-sacrifice/"><b>4-3-2, Sacrifice!</b></a>

..</li>
	<li><a href="http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2007/10/18/4-3-2-the-movie/"><b>4-3-2, the Movie!</b></a>
Part THREE
...</li>
</ul>
Other readings:

	<li>on Eastfilms.net: <a href="http://european-films.net/content/view/719/118/">Review</a> | <a href="http://european-films.net/content/view/780/62/">Interview</a></li>

	<item>
		<title>Gmail IMAP on Thunderbird</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/2007/10/gmail-imap-on-thunderbird/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 27 Oct 2007 22:54:04 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2007/10/28/gmail-imap-on-thunderbird/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<b>[LATER EDIT] <a href="http://groups.google.com/group/Gmail-POP-and-Forwarding/browse_thread/thread/696b8d03c8893c83/e254c725125ac9f4?#e254c725125ac9f4">Gmail IMAP has problems with interpreting 8bit messages</a></b>

<b>[UPDATE] </b><a href="http://googlesystem.blogspot.com/2007/10/gmails-new-version-is-now-available.html"><b>Gmail has a new User Interface</b></a><b>. It looks faster (preloads messages), has a new Contacts Interface, and unfortunately breaks </b><a href="http://gcaldaemon.sourceforge.net/"><b>Gcaldaemon</b></a><b>.</b>

For a week or so Gmail has enabled IMAP support. Although the basics are generally easy to make it work with Thunderbird, in order to get it to work flawlessly, you need to make some adjustments that aren't available off the Google Help.

<!--more-->
After figuring out on my own what I need to do, I found the steps online written <a href="http://blog.rameshbhaskar.com/2007/10/27/configuring-thunderbird-for-gmail-imap-the-way-it-should-be-done/">here</a>:
<blockquote>The [Gmail] folder has sub folders containing the your actual primary set of folders of your Gmail account (Inbox, Starred, Sent Mail, Drafts, All Mail, Spam &amp; Trash). All your labels are shown as folders outside of this. There is an easy method to map your primary folders correctly to Gmail’s, but doing so will deprive you of access to your labels (which show up as folders in Thunderbird).

So the cleanest way to map the folders is to do the following:

1. In Thunderbird select Tools-&gt;Account Settings and select the account that you are using for Gmail IMAP.

2. Select Copies &amp; Folders under that.

3. Sent Mail: Choose ‘Other’ for the “When sending messages, automatically: ” and from the drop down select “AccountName”-&gt;[Gmail]-&gt;Sent Mail

4. Drafts: For drafts as well, choose “Other” and from the drop down select “AccountName”-&gt;[Gmail]-&gt;Drafts

5. Spam: Select “Junk Settings”, check the “Move junk messages to”, select “Other” and from the drop down select “AccountName”-&gt;[Gmail]-&gt;Spam

This fixes most of your folders. The only remaining one is “Trash” and fixing this folder is a bit cumbersome, but it is worth it. By default Deleting a message does not send it to your Gmails “Trash” folder, instead it sends it to Thunderbirds Trash folder. The way IMAP is set up is that Thunderbirds Trash folder is mapped to [IMAP]/Trash on Gmail. So here are your options

1. Let it remain as is and you will have an extra label called [IMAP]/Trash in Gmail, under which all your deleted mails will reside.

2. If you want your deleted mails to be removed from your inbox, but still exist (in your ‘All Mails’ section) then map your trash to ‘[Gmail]/All Mails’

3. If you want your deleted mails to be removed from your inbox, and actually be trashed then map your trash to ‘[Gmail]/Trash’

(1) requires no further action on your part, but (2) &amp; (3) are essentially the same thing, only differing in folder names.

So here’s how you go about fixing your trash folder:

1. Close Thunderbird

2. Go to C:\Documents and Settings\&lt;windows_username&gt;\Application Data\Thunderbird\Profiles\&lt;profile_name&gt;, where &lt;windows_username&gt; is your windows logon and &lt;profile_name&gt; is the current Thunderbird profile you are using.

3. Open prefs.js in your favorite text editor and search for a line that says
<code>user_pref("mail.server.server#.directory-rel", "[ProfD]ImapMail/imap.gmail.com");</code>

Here server# refers to your server number. Basically we have to find out which server number is being used for our Gmail IMAP

4. Just below that line, add an additional line that says
<code>user_pref("mail.server.server#.trash_folder_name", "[Gmail]/Trash");</code>

5. Startup Thunderbird again and your Trash folder below the Inbox should no longer be there. Instead it will use [Gmail]/Trash. If it does show up, then restart Thunderbird a couple of times until the Trash folder below the Inbox goes away. I have no clue why this happens, but this is a quirk I’ve noticed.

Now anything you delete would go to the actual Trash. If you wanted it archived instead of trashing it, specify [Gmail]/All Mail as the trash_folder_name.

Thunderbird should now be configured to properly work with Gmail’s IMAP.</blockquote>]]></content:encoded>

			<wp:comment_date_gmt>2008-10-13 21:18:16</wp:comment_date_gmt>
			<wp:comment_content><![CDATA[have the same issue where all accounts disappeared. I changed the quotes from " to ' didn't work. changed them back...didn't work. any ideas?

It's annoying to say the least.  can I suggest the post gets updated so that people make a copy of their prefs.js before they start fiddling with it.
I wish I did:(]]></wp:comment_content>

	<item>
		<title>Non-Human Resources Management</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/2007/10/non-human-resources-management/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 29 Oct 2007 07:49:25 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2007/10/29/non-human-resources-management/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>* I bumped into <a href="http://desiderius.wordpress.com/2007/03/14/non-human-resources-management/">a previously written post</a> while I was an Erasmus in Poland. I think it needs some re-publishing. Please comment! </p><p>Funny. Of course, during courses we have been taking an interest to learn about how life goes on in Poland. </p><p>Just a couple of minutes ago, I have finished the class and we were still talking about the wages in Poland, and a French guy was so into the matter. “How can you live with these wages? And with the prices as well! I have been to Manufaktura and bought this t-shirt at the same price as in France! It’s totally unacceptable!” </p><p>And he started to express his opinion that the government has to do something about, if not it’s a shitty government and all. </p><p>On the other hand, I keep to my opinion/”theory” that has 3 components: hierarchy + “conspiracy theory”/manipulation + individualism.<br /><strong>Hierarchy</strong><br />In order to maintain this “good life” one needs to think that there’s always somebody who is doing worse (optimistic brainwashing), and also that there’s always somebody who is doing better (fake-goals brainwashing).</p>
<!--more-->
 <p> </p><p><strong>“Conspiracy theory”/manipulation</strong><br />There is always a chance to “take care” of the people around you, but that’s of course for “their own good/sake”. Or at least this is what they say. Some of us are acquainted with this just by paying attention to the mass-media. <blockquote> <p>This is also connected to the previous <em>Social Role of Media</em> course, with Monika. While she was speaking about media ideology, I was quite skeptical about having an ideology behind the media. I understand perfectly that media is often (if not always) connected to politics, but… BUT… I really don’t think that nowadays you have strong ideologies when it comes to media. News can be distorted, but they are often distorted because of the immediate interests - Iraqi war, national Mafia or under-the-counter deals. </p><p>That’s why I couldn’t agree 100%. In my mind at least, and maybe I am totally wrong, but I think that an ideology needs to have a beginning, an on-going present and a future/ending. So… acting upon an ideology is for me different than action upon interests. </p><p>I’m thinking about a good example to differentiate the two… and thinking… and thinking…<br />I guess that I will not find a better one than this: <blockquote> <p>Consider having a plane from Warsaw to Stockholm. </p><p>During the flight, the plane encounters heavy storm and since it cannot go over the clouds, it needs to steer left, almost going straight to Copenhagen.<br />This is an example of acting upon interests. The interest was to get as far away from the storm. </p><p>Then, the situation gets better, and steers back right, in order to follow the course to Stockholm again.<br />This is an example of acting upon goal/ideology. The goal was to get to Stockholm.</p></blockquote> </p><p>Isn’t this a big difference, Monika?</p></blockquote> </p><p><strong>Individualism</strong><br />It is also important to keep the people divided. We were talking about prices at Manufaktura. I’m sure that if the people in Łódź would have started a campaign and convince themselves not to put one step in Manufaktura for two weeks, they would have immediately started to lower their prices! But keeping them to the state of “look how beautiful Manufaktura is &amp; maybe this is why the prices are so big” was a key-point for keeping the business with such high prices! </p><p><strong>Post Scriptum</strong> </p><p>The same thing with the present Polish leadership. Everybody says that the Polish people doesn’t like them, but yet… they voted for them. Conclusion: voting for the least bad option. I wonder how the system works in Poland, because the natural thing would be to have the people not voting and thus not giving enough votes to empower a new leadership! Simply saying “We don’t see a big difference in electing one of the candidates. We want better! Show us better!” </p><p>Without strong and real standards and true criticism there’s no other way to move forward with confidence. Simply waiting for that small chance of having a powerful and clean leadership does nothing good. But then again… who am I to have these thoughts? Romanian mentality if somehow beyond the Polish one, though I think that overall we are more moderate then they are.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Toefl</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/2007/11/toefl/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 09 Nov 2007 08:31:54 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2007/11/09/toefl/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Today is Toefl Day at the Prometric Testing Centre (Dorobanti) - 2PM.

Fans, do make a queue outside and don't disturb public order =))))

PS (unrelated): <a href="http://desiderius.wordpress.com/2007/03/01/polish-messengers/#comment-2368">some things never change</a>...

[<strong>LATER UPDATE</strong>] In the 10min break actually I had a small chit-chat with a girl. Quite nice... BUT MY DAMN ASS only started to acknowledge that last night, when I started to think "Hey..I could have <strike>asked to </strike>kiss<em>ed</em> her. I'd surely have enjoyed it"... but nou-nou-nou.. I was only thinking if I'm getting my ass kicked to or from Sweden after this exam. Maybe it's dumm, but this exam wasn't what I expected somehow, and after the first 10min I got pumped up.

So.. anyway... tu, fata cu <strike>carlionţi </strike>(hai că mă corectez, da' suna mai frumos) păr ondulat, GRE şi o durere de cap... spune-mi drept, nu-i aşa că-mi citeşti kk-blogu? :) Bine, să mă trezesc cu un comment cu alte detalii despre ziua/conversaţia în cauză (drept password check) şi vorbim =)))))

[<strong>EVEN LATER UPDATE</strong>] Presumably I have signed a confidentiality shit not to present questions, partially or fully, from the Toefl Exam. Personally I think this is shit - 1.how many out there wouldn't talk about it, after taking it? and 2.the test isn't that much science, you know!?

I previously wrote that I didn't expect it to be like this - it's exactly the same as with the online demo. After seeing that demo I thought "Ok, this is a demo.. it's supposed to be crap", but guess what - I was wrong. The <em>reading </em>part was 5 texts long... speaking about all the shit there can be: the Sumara civilization, the drawings in the caves, the canal system in England, etc. All that crap that you wouldn't focus on, if you are an average person. Then there was the <em>listening </em>- again about some unusual stuff, but interesting at least - with some questions that had the multiple choice answers so sublime that once again the average person wouldn't pin-point (I'm not that far from average - I'm not implying anything here). The <em>speaking</em>... You had 30 seconds to answer a question. Why is that? If this is a test that focuses on speaking a language, shouldn't the speaking part be as free as possible? I mean, Jesus.. this is not multiple choice for crying out loud. You don't tick - you speak! And you speak, and not commenting a football match or a horse-dog competition. <em>Writing </em>was ok - it was simply the usual. I even promoted lowering the gas emission levels on cars :p Though the Cambridge testing was far more demanding, and although it was like that and I only got a C at CAE, I enjoyed it more.

All in all, this ETS Toefl felt more like testing my focus-level and the power to be chill when using English. Far from testing English knowledge, except hinting for some "colloquial" terms - NOT! So let's recap: weird texts, demand of unusual vocabulary, demand of fast speaking pace, and not to mention.. demand of sitting still for 4 hours in a row in front of an ancient software application which didn't allow you to copy-paste the usual way (it had those old 3D buttons along the textbox for that)! One more thing: the picture that was taken of me...well, I had my eyes closed, so.. I hope I'm not making jokes now only to find out that I'll get a low score, but.. doesn't that mean that I took the test blind<em>-folded</em> ?]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Title of the Song?</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/2007/11/title-of-the-song/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 10 Nov 2007 19:00:08 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2007/11/10/title-of-the-song/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Season 4 - Episode 7 - Grey's Anatomy

Who knows the song that plays when the afro-american (politically correct) gets the news that his wife didn't make it?

The lyrics go like this:
<ul>
	<li>you're still so young,
but ya feel so old</li>
	<li>and i think you're gonna turn soon,
gonna go with my moves,
just might lose you for good...
listen i can't fight your demons,
cuz i'd have to fight you..
they're so far inside you,
and i just can't seem to get through.
ain't any my business,
any my praise,
but i still had to try"</li>
</ul>
[<strong>LATER EDIT</strong>] Thanks to Kelly - there's an answer: Joe Purdy - San Jose

You can listen to the song at high quality <a href="http://joepurdy.com/players_html/player9.html">on his website</a>.

[youtube=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JnTP3pjPzwE] ]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>I Foresee..</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/2007/11/i-foresee/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 14 Nov 2007 20:11:59 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2007/11/14/i-foresee/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Question: <b>How come the Romanian President, Traian Băsescu, is so sure that at least one of the possible two referendums regarding the uninominal electoral system will be validated?</b>

Context: On November 25th, 2007, Romanians will not only vote for the first delegates to the European Parliament, but will also have a say whether they would like a <b>transitional</b> uninominal electoral system (50% uninominal, 50% list-based and redistributable) <b>or</b> a <b>pure</b> one (all the delegates, in order of the gathered votes, will be elected among the available places at Senate and at the Deputy Chamber). The first option is already a written law (the Government took responsibility for it), and awaits for the President to promulgate it. The deadline for that to happen is November 26th. The later option is the President's and the majority's choice. Even so, it is said that not many people will come to vote, and the referendum needs 50%+1 of the available electors to come to vote, or else it is invalidated.

What if: the President has affirmed strongly that if the referendum is invalidated, and if the after-reports that follow it conclude that the measures taken, or the lack of them, will have made the Romanians not to show up for voting, <b>he will re-engage in a second referendum on the same topic</b>.

Answer: it is true that the public surveys show that the referendum has high chances to be invalidated due to low presence. Today the President stated that there will be a surprise coming up this Saturday. <b>He will link the referendum to a future step that he will take in case of failure - resignation</b>. The previous referendum, when the Parliament asked for his impeachment, showed a figure of 44.45% as turnout, with almost 75% against the impeachment.

PS: let's see how this turns out]]></content:encoded>

post timestamp: November 20, 2007 @ 10:40]]></wp:comment_content>
			<wp:comment_approved>1</wp:comment_approved>
			<wp:comment_type></wp:comment_type>

	<item>
		<title>How low can you go?</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/2007/11/how-low-can-you-go/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 23 Nov 2007 13:47:36 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2007/11/23/how-low-can-you-go/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>I don't know who will actually believe me - but although I may seem geekish (I'm still far away from google-ing from PDA, and others :) ) - I'm still striving to be a normal guy. So... when I said that I won't be blogging while in Finland, I meant it! But... when you are watching somebody to get up (like.. really watching... and <a href="http://littleblogthatcould.wordpress.com/2007/11/22/1337-lullaby/">actually trying to imagine where did she ended up with counting</a>, since she seems to be so tired..) You get a need to do something other than that.</p> <p>So, in short:</p> <ul> <li>fixed phones </li><li>washed dishes </li><li>went to the 10min-away shop to buy just a bottle of coke </li><li>read every stupid news on <a href="http://www.realitatea.net">Realitatea</a>  <ul> <li>I have been reading so much about the referendum (even though I had in mind to even forget that I can vote this Sunday) that I think I simply won't go</li></ul> </li><li>installed <a href="http://www.ubuntu.org">Ubuntu 7.10</a> with the help of <a href="http://www.wubi-installer.org">Wubi</a> on my HP DV6054ea, because there was no CD around  <ul> <li>I have problems launching my Wireless card, but that's also because I cannot properly connect to Internet through a wired connection, so downloading packages, etc is an issue  </li><li>It has a weird reaction to sound: on startup the sound is looped  </li><li>Why? - Because I wanted to have a system which consumes as little battery as possible when I'm on a trip</li></ul> </li><li>went through a list of <a href="http://www.networkworld.com/news/2007/110707-10-career-killers-to.html">10 career-killers to avoid</a> - <em>italics</em> = failed, <strong>bold</strong> = ok  <ul> <li><strong>failing to have a life plan</strong> - although I have a perspective on this, I think it's stupid to have a plan. When you have a job interview, and they ask you the world-wide known "Where do you see yourself in 5 years?" - that has become simply a question to check if you can imagine and speak. The world is so fast nowadays that even asking "a year from now" is slightly begging for a surreal answer  </li><li><strong>not keeping your skills current</strong> - hmm, I'm quite ok with that, thought I have a general idea that you can lose yourself/your path if you become genuinely interested in a million things  </li><li><em>failing to deliver results</em> - I have a problem with this. Sometimes I put this secondly after "It has to be best/how I want it" and thus.. I fail to deliver results on time.  </li><li><strong>confusing efficiency with effectiveness</strong> - not happening  </li><li><strong>believing that you are irreplaceable</strong> - I do think that I'm unique, but if you take me part by part, I'm awfully replaceable.  </li><li><strong>knowing all the answers</strong> - I'm still curious at 23. I have to say sometime I invent the answer (based on current knowledge), but apparently I'm not the only one, so it's ok  </li><li><strong>surrounding yourself with brown-nosers</strong> - not happening. I can even say that I've rejected those that became like that, and .. with a bit of sorrow.. most of the people around me are quite good critics, which sometimes doesn't help when you want to hear "you can do it, you're the best I know" :D  </li><li><strong><em>forgetting to give credit to others</em></strong> - I have to pay more attention to make that clear. Sometimes I'm very much aware that someone else is better, or did a great job, and I'm in debt, or simply "bowing" in front, but I don't make it clear - I don't say it. It happens more often that I will show my gratitude or acknowledge past-credits by paying back somehow. Maybe it's something similar to the fact that I don't really get the point in hand-shaking. While it's ok to do it.. I feel it's a bit of a habit and nothing more. Imagine you would have kissing girls as a habit... I don't think you would do it indefinitely - first of all, you might find ugly girls, second of all, it will turn into nothing-special.  </li><li><em>self-promote</em> - hmm, it might be true. I'm confident in myself, with small/rare exceptions... but most probably I do not promote myself - otherwise someone would be dead-wrong when saying "if I were you, I would have bought a cool two-wheel engine a long time ago"  </li><li><strong><em>losing perspective</em></strong> - semi-happening. It depends quite often on the personal life. I can get distracted or dissapointed by the personal life, and that influences a lot the reaction in front of roadblocks  </li><li><strong>TOTAL: ok = 6 + 0.5x2 = 7, bad = 2 + 0.5x2 = 3</strong></li></ul> </li><li>and I've also gone through <a href="http://www.computerworld.com/action/article.do?command=viewArticleBasic&amp;articleId=305966&amp;source=NLT_CAR&amp;nlid=5">nine nontechie skills that hiring managers wish you had</a>  <ul> <li>writing ability - checked (both formal and informal)  </li><li>an understanding of business-process mapping and tools - checked  </li><li>an aptitude for public speaking - checked (I've spoken lots of time in front of more than 100 people)  </li><li>an understanding of accounting - checked  </li><li>the ability to work with a team - .. if it's a good feedback relationship inside the team, I'm in :)  </li><li><strong>TOTAL: where are you, hiring manager? your apprentice is waiting for a sign!:D</strong></li></ul> </li><li>going to watch Grey's Anatomy - Latest episode =&nbsp; I think this is like the motto of this post. If I ended up watching this, then.. I am definitely very close to "blow my brains" due to getting extremely <strike>bored</strike> chill</li></ul>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Gmail IMAP in Windows Mail/Outlook</title>
		<link>http://blog.andreineculau.com/2007/11/gmail-imap-in-windows-mailoutlook/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 28 Nov 2007 22:09:10 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://andreineculau.wordpress.com/2007/11/29/gmail-imap-in-windows-mailoutlook/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Recently I have figured out the best way to have Gmail IMAP in Windows (Live) Mail/Outlook (Express).</p> <p>Other than the <a href="http://mail.google.com/support/bin/topic.py?topic=12760">usual settings</a> you can do, there is something that it is not specified in the basic configuration. The Gmail IMAP inbox is structured to have Inbox, [Gmail], and other folders which are nothing else than your defined labels.</p> <p>The way these Microsoft products are built, they do not allow to specify a special folder to point to [Gmail]\X (a subfolder). Therefore you cannot link (tell Mail/Outlook) a special item (sent, deleted and junk) to point to your real folders, residing on the IMAP account.</p> <p>But there is a.. semi-trick. Something that maybe it is not that obvious to start with. There's an option that says "Root folder path", under the IMAP tab of the Account properties window.</p> <p>If you choose "[Gmail]" for that, deselect "Check for new messages in all folders", then select "Store special folders on IMAP server" and fill in with Sent Mail, Drafts, Trash, Spam - there you go.. you will see some nice usual folders in your Microsoft E-mail client. The only disadvantage is that you won't be able to take advantage of labeling (since the label folders are not made visible).</p> <p>* This has been tried on Windows Live Mail</p>]]></content:encoded>

			<wp:comment_content><![CDATA[Nice writeup.

A small tip: I you do want to use your Gmail labels as folders in an IMPA client. Simply add the prefix

"[GMAIL]/"

before the label in the Gmail webinterface. The next time you refresh the IMAP folders each label with the prefix [Gmail]/ will appear as an IMAP folder.
if you have a label in Gmail named "Work"

Change the label to "[Gmail]/Work"

This will display as folder "Work" in the IMAP client.

Cheers,
Joakim]]></wp:comment_content>

			<wp:comment_content><![CDATA[I have a similar problem, but it is really related to Microsoft Outlook (the full Office product).

Outlook doesn't allow you to map special folders to folders within the IMAP server, with the exception of the Sent Items folder. Folders like Spam, Drafts and Bin can't be mapped and as a result, your deleted items or drafts are saved under top folders (which are labels in Gmail) instead of under [Google Mail]\Drafts (for the example of drafts).

Sucks isn't it?]]></wp:comment_content>
